front.gametext: Use X Force to deploy on your warrior, where X = (7 - warrior's power). X cannot fall below 1. May target a character or creature using X Force. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a character, 2 if targeting a creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Hand-crafted weapon of choice among Wookiees. Fires explosive 'quarrels' (which look like blaster bolts). Requires great strength to use. Extra ammo carried on bandoleers.

front.title: •Brainiac
front.gametext: * Power = v(3(X-Y)+2(A-B)+ p) (minimum power =1). X = Dark Side hand cards; Y = Light Side hand cards; A = total number of Dark icons in play; B = total number of Light icons in play; p?= 3.141592653589793238462643383...
front.lore: BoShek nicknamed this male Siniteen 'Brainiac' due to his ability to calculate hyperspace coordinates in his head. 'He's the brains, sweetheart!'

combo: Brainiac + Mantellian Savrip Brainiac's forfeit is equal to the total number of cards in your opponent's hand, so he may often be sacrificed to the Mantellian Savrip to cover all battle damage and attrtion against you.
rulings: Counts as a card in hand for determining value Y.
Is not an astromech.
Cannot occupy astromech capacity slot.
Square root of a negative number uses his minimum power of 1.
Square root must take the positive root.
Do not round unless required to do something that requires a whole number, in which case round to nearest whole number.

front.title: •Bravo 1
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Ric piloting, immune to attrition < 4 and draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
front.lore: Ric Olie's starfighter at the battle of Naboo. Control configuration modified by Ric himself.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin
combo: Bravo 1 + Ric Olie, Bravo Leader + one other piloted Bravo Squadron starfighter Draws three battle destinies.

front.title: •Bravo 2
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Dolphe piloting, immune to attrition < 4. While at Naboo system, your Bravo Squadron pilots at same system are forfeit +2.
front.lore: Starfighter assigned to Officer Dolphe at the battle of Naboo. Damaged when the Trade Federation first invaded his planet, but Dolphe was able to make the necessary repairs.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Bravo 3
front.gametext: Deploys - 1 to Naboo. May add one pilot. While Arven piloting, immune to attrition < 4. While at Naboo system, opponent's battle destiny draws are - 1 here.
front.lore: Arven Wendik's starfighter at the Battle of Naboo. Oldest starfighter in the Naboo corps.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Bravo 4
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Rya piloting, immune to attrition < 4. While at Naboo system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.
front.lore: Flown by Rya Kirsch at the Battle of Naboo. Bravo 4 was primarily used as a recon vessel before it began its assault on the Trade Federation's Droid Control Ship.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Bravo 5
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. May add 1 pilot. While Ellberger piloting, immune to attrition < 3. While at Naboo, opponent's battleships present are power -1.
front.lore: Ellberger's starfighter at the battle of Naboo has excellent evasion capabilities, and can remain a threat to its target for as long as possible.

pulledBy: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Bravo Fighter
front.gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 3. During your control phase, if landed aboard Blockade Flagship, may draw one destiny. If destiny > 6, place Bravo Fighter in your Used Pile; Flagship 'blown away.'
front.lore: Flown by an unknown pilot who likes to spin a lot. Played the deciding role in the attack against the Droid Control Ship.

rulings: May not attempt to blow away Blockade Flagship unless its starship card is on table.

front.title: •Bravo Fighter (V)
front.gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 4. May add one astromech. During battle, may target a starship with no character piloting. Draw destiny. If destiny > defense value, target hit. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Flown by an unknown pilot who likes to spin a lot. Played the deciding role in the attack against the Droid Control Ship.

front.title: •Bren Quersey
front.gametext: Adds 2 to anything he pilots. When piloting Red 8 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Raithal system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.
front.lore: Piloted Red 8 at the Battle of Yavin. Dreamed of attending the prestigious Raithal Academy. Trained on X-wings by Wedge Antilles.

front.title: •Bright Hope
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 6 passengers. Deploys and moves like a starfighter. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Modified medium transport. Well armored. Has expanded passenger capacity to facilitate evacuation. The last transport to escape Hoth. Nearly destroyed by the Stalker.

front.title: •Bright Hope (V)
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 6 passengers. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. If in battle with another Rebel capital starship, may draw destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power.
front.lore: Modified medium transport. Well armored. Has expanded passenger capacity to facilitate evacuation. The last transport to escape Hoth. Nearly destroyed by the Stalker.

front.title: •Brisky Morning Munchen
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per game, may deploy Jar Jar from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If you just lost Jar Jar from a site, may place him here. At any time, may use 3 Force to take Jar Jar from here into hand. Episode I
front.lore: 'Den boom! Getten berry scared, and grabben dat Jedi, and pow! Mesa here. Huh! Mesa getten berry, berry scared. Mm.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Bron Burs
front.gametext: When alone at a site, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Adds 1 to each of his weapon destiny draws. Immune to attrition < X, where X=number of Imperials present.
front.lore: Ugly scars cover this former commando from southern Nentan. Likes to be on his own. Crack shot. Off and on partner of Debnoli. Relies on intuition to survive.

front.title: •C-3PO (See-Threepio)
front.gametext: Total power at same site is +2 for each of your droid/Rebel pairs present, including C-3PO. R2-D2 is forfeit +2 when present.
front.lore: Cybot Galactica 3PO human-cyborg relations droid. Fluent in over six million forms of communication. 112 years old. Has never been memorywiped... as far as he knows.

combo: C-3PO (See-Threepio) + Chewie With Blaster Rifle Chewie With Blaster Rifle adds one battle destiny if with C-3PO.
rulings: A character may not be used in multiple pairs.

front.title: •C1-10P (Chopper)
front.gametext: While aboard a starship, it is power and defense value +2 and immune to Lateral Damage. May 'fly' (landspeed = 2). Permanent weapon is Electroshock Prod (may target a character of ability < 4; target may not use its game text for remainder of turn).
front.lore: Information broker and spy.

front.title: •Cal Alder
front.gametext: Power +1 at Defensive Perimeter. Your vehicles move for free if moving toward same site as Cal.
front.lore: An expert Scout originally from Kai'Shebbol in the Kathol sector. Served with Bren Derlin for many years. Patrols the outer perimeter of Echo Base.

rulings: Light's vehicle moves for free as long as it is headed in Cal's direction when it starts to move.

front.title: •Cal Alder (V)
front.gametext: May deploy as a 'react'. Deploys -1 to same site as a Rebel leader. Unless with Luke, opponent must first use 1 Force to fire a weapon at same site. Elis Helrot may not transport characters to or from here.
front.lore: An expert Scout originally from Kai'Shebbol in the Kathol sector. Served with Bren Derlin for many years. Patrols the outer perimeter of Echo Base.

front.title: •Caldera Righim
front.gametext: Unless Great Warrior on table, opponent must have total ability < 8 to initiate a battle at same site. Also, whenever a battle is initiated at same site both players may draw up to 2 cards from top of their Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Male Talz. Somewhat of a pacifist, Caldera has always been an opponent to violence in the cantina. Personal friend of Wuher.

front.title: Caller
front.gametext: Deploy on a Rebel or Jawa. During your control phase, may steal one droid at same site if it is controlled by a Restraining Bolt. After droid is stolen, Restraining Bolt returns to owner's hand.
front.lore: Hand-held device that can remotely command restraining bolt. Each caller can be keyed to specific bolt. Used by many species. Also called 'restraining bolt activators.

front.title: •Camie
front.gametext: Deploys free to Anchorhead. Forfeit +1 when present with Fixer. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy Luke (of power < 4), Biggs or Fixer to same Tatooine site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Friend of Luke and Biggs. Fixer's girlfriend. Lives in Anchorhead. Feels sorry for Luke, but still calls him 'Wormie.' Her parents have underground hydroponics gardens.

front.title: Cantina Brawl
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to cause a fight to break out in the Cantina. Both players draw destiny. All characters in Cantina with an ability number matching either destiny draw are lost.
front.lore: '...watch your step. This place can be a little rough.' The Mos Eisley Cantina harbors smugglers, thieves, cutthroats, criminals and bounty hunters!

front.title: •Capital Support
front.gametext: Each pilot deploys -1 (or -2 if with an admiral) aboard a capital starship. Each capital starship with a pilot character aboard is immune to attrition < 4 (or adds 2 to immunity). During each of your control phases, opponent loses 1 Force for each battleground site your general controls that is related to a system you occupy.

front.title: •Captain Cassian Andor
front.gametext: Deploys -1 if a Rebel leader on table. Once per game, may place a character in your Lost Pile out of play to cancel a just drawn weapon or battle destiny here. If just lost, may activate 1 Force. While at opponent's location immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Information Broker and Spy

front.title: •Captain Han Solo
front.gametext: Deploys only on Falcon, Hoth or Cloud City. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Falcon, adds one battle destiny and 2 to maneuver. Once during each battle, may use 2 Force to cancel one opponent's destiny just drawn and cause a re-draw.
front.lore: Smuggler and scoundrel. His piloting abilities have become legend in the Rebellion. Intends to leave the Alliance to pay off Jabba the Hutt.

combo: Captain Han Solo + Life Debt Deploy Chewbacca for free from Reserve Deck if Han is defending a battle alone.
Captain Han Solo + Millenium Falcon + Punch It!

Captain Han Solo + Millennium Falcon + R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo) Millennium Falcon is power 8, Maneuver 8 and Hyperspeed 8 and immune to attrition < 5. All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin on that Falcon means a battle destiny of 8.
Captain Han Solo + Millenium Falcon + Moving To Attack Position

front.title: •Captain Hera Syndulla
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything she pilots. If with an Imperial (or two Rebels), adds one battle destiny. During battle, if you just drew a destiny < number of Rebels here, may cancel and redraw that destiny.
front.lore: Female Twi'lek leader.

front.title: •Captain Madakor
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. While piloting Radiant VII and you have no other starships at same system, opponent may not draw more than one battle destiny here.
front.lore: Captain of the Radiant VII. Has gained her rank through consistent excellent performance, and has one of the finest service records of all Republic officers.

combo: Captain Madakor + Lieutenant Williams + General Calrissian + Radiant VII Put Nien Nunb in the passenger slot, and you've got a one-ship juggernaut with 12 power, two battle destiny, immunity to attrition < 5, and a host of special abilities!

front.title: •Captain Panaka
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to same site as Amidala. Once per game, may deploy a blaster on Panaka from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if Panaka just fired a blaster and 'hit' a character, opponent loses 2 Force.
front.lore: Leader of Amidala's royal guard who personally supervised the Queen's weapon and self-defense training. Served under Captain Magneta before his current assignment.

pulls: A blaster to deploy on Panaka
combo: Captain Panaka + Panaka's Blaster + Blaster Proficiency: Great chance to hit a Dark Jedi with a blaster, nearly impossible to miss others.
Captain Panaka + Queen Amidala + We Don't Have Time For This If Amidala and Panaka are in a battle together, add two battle destiny.

front.title: •Captain Raymus Antilles
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 while piloting any Rebel capital starship). Deploys -1 aboard Tantive IV. While aboard Tantive IV, it is immune to Lateral Damage and attrition < 5.
front.lore: Alderaanian leader.

front.title: •Captain Rex, 501st Legion
front.gametext: Your clones deploy -1 here. While at an [Episode I] battleground site, adds one battle destiny. Permanent weapon is •Twin Blasters (may target a character for free; draw two destiny; target hit and forfeit -3 if total destiny -2 > defense value).
front.lore: Leader. Clone trooper.

combo: Commander Cody + Captain Rex

front.title: •Captain Tarpals
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of your other Gungans at same site. Opponent's characters may not move to underwater sites. Once per turn, if you just drew a Gungan for battle destiny, may deploy that Gungan for free to cancel that destiny and re-draw.
front.lore: Gungan leader of the forces that patrol and protect the city of Otoh Gunga. Consistantly placed in the top ten of the Big Nasty Free-For-All.

combo: Captain Tarpals + Wesa Gotta Grand Army Make opponent's undercover spy lost.

front.title: •Captain Tarpals' Electropole
front.gametext: Deploys on Captain Tarpals. May 'throw' (place in Used Pile) to target a character, creature or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. If destiny +3 > defense value, target is landspeed = 0 and power - 3 for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Tarpals' electropole is nearly as old as he is. Used to enforce the laws of Otoh Gunga.

front.title: •Captain Verrack
front.gametext: Allows your starship weapons at same location to fire and deploy for 1 less Force. While aboard your capital starship, adds 1 to each of its weapon destiny draws (2 when targeting a capital starship).
front.lore: Mon Calamari computer technician. Expert in power systems. His skills are desperately needed by Rebel fleet. Gunner.

front.title: •Captain Yutani
front.gametext: Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one artillery weapon or Portable Fusion Generator to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. May move Medium Repeating Blaster Cannon by himself (for free).
front.lore: Scout and heavy weapons specialist. Carries custom repulsorlift compensators to allow fluid movement with light artillery weapons.

front.title: •Captain Yutani With Blaster Cannon
front.gametext: Artillery weapons here are 'powered.'  Permanent weapon is Blaster Cannon (may target a character, creature, or vehicle at same or adjacent site for free; draw destiny; target 'hit,' and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Scout.

front.title: •Captive Fury
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Force drain bonus from IT-O this turn.  LOST: During your battle phase, any of your escorted captives at same site may initiate and participate in one battle (they may not use weapons or devices and you may not voluntarily forfeit or relocate them).
front.lore: Chewie's life debt to Han forced him to act, retaliating unexpectedly against his captors.

rulings: Other characters at the site participate in the battle if they normally would.
Light must choose at least one captive to participate, but may choose more.
The battle ends immediately if either side has no presence, but the participating captives provide presence if applicable.

front.title: Captive Pursuit
front.gametext: USED: If a battle was just initiated at a site, target a captive present. Captive released if you win battle.  LOST: Cancel Aiiii! Aaa! Aggggggggggggg!, Sonic Bombardment, Interrogation Array, This Is Some Rescue or Special Delivery.
front.lore: Han could have used a hand. Fortunately, Luke still had one to give.

front.title: •Careful Planning
front.gametext: USED: If a battle was just initiated, draw destiny and activate up to that much Force.  STARTING: If you have not deployed an Objective, deploy from Reserve Deck one battleground site (or two <> sites) related to your starting location. Place Interrupt in Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Alliance troops on planet must plan ahead to achieve success in military operations.

combo: Careful Planning  + Yavin 4: Massassi Throne Room + 2 generic sites A very popular deck (TRM) that typically starts with <>Farm and <>Swamp. The <>Farm helps with your activation and the <> Swamp lets you pull Nudjs out of your deck to absorb the Dark Side icons to slow their game early. You end up activating 5 Force and giving your opponent none - and you go first in game.
rulings: If deploying two generic sites, they must be battlegrounds.
The site(s) deployed must be related to the owner's starting location and must be battlegrounds immediately upon deploying.
The site(s) may be deployed even if the starting location was converted, or failed to convert an opponent's starting location.

front.title: •Careful Planning (V)
front.gametext: If your starting location was a system, deploy from Reserve Deck a related site (must be a battleground if the system is a non-battleground or Endor) with < 3 [Light Side Force] icons and up to three Effects that are always [Immune to Alter].  Place this Interrupt in Lost Pile.
front.lore: Alliance troops on planet must plan ahead to achieve success in military operations.

cards.conceptBy: (Original concept by Kevin Brownell - Illinois States 2004)
rulings: The site's battleground status is checked immediately upon deploying.
The site may be deployed even if the starting location was converted, or failed to convert an opponent's starting location.

front.title: •CC-2237 (Odd Ball)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Droid starfighters are power and forfeit -1 here. During battle, may add or subtract 1 from a just drawn even destiny.
front.lore: Clone trooper commander.

front.title: •Cell 2187
front.gametext: Deploy on any Death Star site except Docking Bay 327. Target your spy or leader not on Death Star. When target reaches Utinni Effect, draw destiny. Release that many captives from the Detention Block Corridor. Lose Utinni Effect.
front.lore: 'Aren't you a little short for a stormtrooper?'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Chadra-Fan
front.gametext: Power and forfeit +2 while Kabe at Audience Chamber. During your control phase, may glance at one card randomly selected from opponent's hand; if that card is a character weapon, may 'steal' it into your hand.
front.lore: Short, intelligent and selfish. Their enhanced vision and smell make them outstanding Thieves. Communicate with pheromones and high-pitched squeaks.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Chandrila
front.gametext: Light:  If you occupy with a capital starship, Force generation +2 for you here. Mon Mothma deploys -2 at any Chandrila location.  Dark:  If you control with two Star Destroyers, Force drain +1 here. If you control with no capital starships, Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Changing The Odds
front.gametext: If opponent just drew battle destiny (or destiny for Watto's Chance Cube), subtract one from that destiny. OR If you just verified opponent's Reserve Deck, search that Reserve Deck and place one Interrupt found there out of play.
front.lore: Qui-Gon used his Jedi abilities to insure that there was no 'chance' involved with the use of Watto's chance cube.

front.title: Chasm
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If a unique (•) card is drawn for destiny and a duplicate is on table, destiny card is lost (destiny = 0). If duplicated card is a character, it loses immunity to attrition for rest of turn and player must lose 2 Force or lose that character. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: At Cloud City, Luke came face to face with his own destiny. Looking into the abyss, he made his decision.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Result will trigger successfully even if character has no immunity to attrition to lose.

front.title: •Chewbacca
front.gametext: Power +1 at same location as Han. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Falcon, also adds 1 to maneuver. Your vehicles, starships, and droids at same site that are 'hit' and about to be lost go to Used Pile instead.
front.lore: Wookiee smuggler from Kashyyyk. Over 200 years old. Top-notch mechanic and pilot. Jabba has large bounty on this 'walking carpet.' Friends call him Chewie...or Fuzzball.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: •Chewbacca Of Kashyyyk
front.gametext: Deploys -2 on Endor. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When targeted by a weapon, may 'roar' (defense value = 4). When on Endor during your deploy phase, may deploy Lumat and/or Wuta for free here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Wookiee scout. Volunteered for Han's Endor strike team. Keeps his distance, but doesn't look like he's keeping his distance. Always thinks with his stomach.

front.title: •Chewbacca, Protector
front.gametext: Deploys -3 to same site as Leia. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if Falcon). Once per turn, may target opponent's character at same site who has power < 4 and cancel target's game text for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Chewie honored his life debt to Han by protecting Leia. Posed as the mercenary Snoova while on Coruscant. Smuggler. Wookiee.

rulings: If Leia is inactive (such as being an imprisoned or an escorted captive) then Chewie won't deploy -3.

front.title: •Chewbacca's Bowcaster
front.gametext: Deploy on Chewie, or use 4 Force to deploy on your other Wookiee. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 3 Force (for free if Chewie firing). Draw two destiny. Target hit if total destiny > defense value. If hit by Chewie, target's forfeit = 0.
front.lore: Specially modified by Chewbacca. Fires larger bolts with more accuracy. Superior targeting at long distances.

combo: Chewbacca's Bowcaster + any Chewbacca + Wookiee Strangle + Sorry About The Mess Your opponent has two characters less than he started the turn with - in your control phase.

front.title: •Chewie
front.gametext: Must deploy on Hoth, but may move elsewhere. May not be deployed if three or more of opponent's unique (•) characters on table.
front.lore: Loyal Wookiee companion of Captain Han Solo. Co-pilot of the Millennium Falcon. Leia referred to him as a 'walking carpet.'

front.title: •Chewie (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots.  While piloting Falcon, it is maneuver +2, Chewie draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise, and your battle destiny draws (and total battle destiny) at same system may not be modified, canceled, or reset by opponent.
front.lore: Loyal Wookiee companion of Captain Han Solo. Co-pilot of the Millennium Falcon. Leia referred to him as a 'walking carpet'.

front.title: •Chewie With Blaster Rifle
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of any freighter he pilots. Adds one battle destiny if with C-3PO. Permanent weapon is blaster rifle (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if destiny > defense value).
front.lore: Wookiee smuggler. 'Wraaaaaarw!'

front.title: •Chewie With Bowcaster
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Falcon. While 'hit,' draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Permanent weapon is •Chewbacca's Bowcaster (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw two destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: Wookiee smuggler.

front.title: •Chewie, Enraged
front.gametext: X = number of Imperials present. While with Han or Leia, adds 2 to your battle destiny draws here. During your turn, target one Imperial of power < 5 present. Target's game text canceled for remainder of turn. End of your turn: Use 2 Force to maintain OR Lose 1 Force to place in Used Pile OR Place out of play.
front.lore: Smuggler. Very few people need to be told that angry Wookiees should be given a wide berth.

front.title: •Chewie's AT-ST
front.gametext: Deploy only to Endor or same site as Chewie or opponent's AT-ST. May add 2 pilots or passengers. Subtracts 1 from power of other AT-STs at same site. Immune to attrition < 4 when Chewie piloting.
front.lore: Enclosed Chewie's daring capture of an Imperial AT-ST helped turn the tide in the Battle of Endor.

combo: Chewie's AT-ST + Chewbacca + Wedge Antilles (piloting) Power 12 and a battle destiny.

front.title: •Chief Chirpa
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one non-unique Ewok to same Endor site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Leader of Wicket's Ewok tribe for 42 seasons. Head of the Council of Elders. Decided to spare Han's Rebels and join their fight against the Empire.

front.title: •Chirrut Imwe
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated here, may peek at the top card of any Reserve Desk; return it or place it on top of owner's Force Pile. If just lost, may take into hand from reserve deck; reshuffle or retrieve Baze. Once per game, you may re-circulate.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: Choke
front.gametext: During your control phase, cancel the game text of one unique (•) alien for remainder of turn. OR If you just forfeited an alien, cancel all remaining attrition against you.
front.lore: Reaching out with the Force, Luke rendered Ortugg unconscious without doing the Gamorrean any actual harm.

cancels: Game text of one unique alien
All remaining attrition against you if you just forfeited an alien

front.title: City In The Clouds / You Truly Belong Here With Us
front.gametext: City In The Clouds:Deploy Bespin system and a Cloud City battleground site. {While} this side up, once per turn may use 1 Force to deploy a Cloud City battleground site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. {Flip} this card if you control two Cloud City battleground sites and occupy Bespin system, and opponent controls no Cloud City sites.You Truly Belong Here With Us:{While} this side up, once per game, may deploy Cloud City Celebration from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once during your control phase, may use 2 Force to take one Interrupt into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, may move your character as a 'react' to a battle or Force drain at a Cloud City site. {Flip} this card if opponent controls more Cloud City sites than you.

back.title: City In The Clouds / You Truly Belong Here With Us
back.gametext: City In The Clouds:Deploy Bespin system and a Cloud City battleground site. {While} this side up, once per turn may use 1 Force to deploy a Cloud City battleground site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. {Flip} this card if you control two Cloud City battleground sites and occupy Bespin system, and opponent controls no Cloud City sites.You Truly Belong Here With Us:{While} this side up, once per game, may deploy Cloud City Celebration from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once during your control phase, may use 2 Force to take one Interrupt into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, may move your character as a 'react' to a battle or Force drain at a Cloud City site. {Flip} this card if opponent controls more Cloud City sites than you.

front.title: •Civil Disorder
front.gametext: Deploy on opponent's side of table. At the end of opponent's deploy phase, if they did not deploy a card with ability, opponent loses 2 Force. Effect lost if opponent has more cards with ability on table than you. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Attention. This is Lando Calrissian. The Empire has taken control of the city. I advise everyone to leave before more Imperial troops arrive.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Clak'dor VII
front.gametext: Light:  If you occupy, each Bith character is destiny +2.  Dark:  If you control, each Bith character is destiny -1 and Ghhhk is power +2 in battles at a holosite.

combo: Clak'dor VII + Red 9 + Lieutenant Naytaan Add 1 to Force drain

front.title: Clak'dor VII Operative
front.gametext: While at a Clak'dor VII site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is forfeit +1 (and power +1 if your musician is on Clak'dor VII) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Clak'dor VII from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Hired by the Alliance after the ecological disaster on Clak'dor VII. Brought food supplies and medicine to the Bith, securing their loyalty to the Rebellion.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Clash Of Sabers
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to target a character present with your warrior with a lightsaber. Target cannot move or battle until the end of your next turn. OR Use 1 Force to search your Reserve Deck, take one Uncontrollable Fury into hand and reshuffle. OR Cancel Presence Of The Force.
front.lore: Weooww - bzzzzt - bzt - weoww - bzzzt - weoww - weow - bzt - bzt - bzt - weow - bzzzzzt!

rulings: Works with a character with a permanent lightsaber weapon (even if their game text has been canceled).

front.title: •Clinging To The Edge
front.gametext: If opponent's Dark Jedi with at least one combat card just initiated lightsaber combat against your Jedi with none, draw 3 destiny and choose 2 to use for lightsaber combat destiny. You may take other card into hand, or return it to top of Reserve Deck.
front.lore: There are some times, more than others, when you should not look down.

front.title: •••Clone Squad Leader
front.gametext: Your other clones present are each forfeit +1. Once during battle with your clone, may cancel and redraw your just drawn battle destiny. When moving with a 'squad' of up to three other clones, they all move simultaneously for 1 Force.
front.lore: Clone trooper.

rulings: When he is about to move, may target other clones to move with him.
Does not permit the other clones to perform a move they are not otherwise able to make.

front.title: Clone Trooper
front.gametext: Deploys free to same site as your [Clone Army]: general, leader, or Padawan. Once during battle, if firing a blaster, may cancel and redraw your just drawn weapon destiny. While with your clone, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Cloning Cylinders
front.gametext: Use 4 Force to deploy on table. During your draw phase, may stack a non-unique clone from your Lost Pile here face down. At the start of your turn, turn all cards here face up. You may deploy any face up card stacked here (as if from hand). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Close Air Support
front.gametext: Deploy on table. While your Z-95 occupies a system or cloud sector, once per turn your scout at a related exterior site may add one battle destiny (if Z-95 is Tala 1 or Tala 2, may also add one destiny to total power only).
front.lore: Attack plans for General Madine's commandos often require coordinated air support. A number of Z-95 headhunters have been modified to operate in this role.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas
rulings: The Z-95 itself must have presence, such as via a permanent pilot or character aboard.

front.title: •Closer?!
front.gametext: During your move phase, use 1 Force to relocate one of your starships from a planet system to any related asteroid sector (or vice versa). This movement is free if a smuggler is on board. OR Cancel Rogue Asteroid or Close Call.
front.lore: 'I'm going in closer to one of those big ones.' 'Closer?!' 'Closer?!' 'Graarg?!'

canceledBy: Ghhhk & Those Rebels Won't Escape Us

front.title: Cloud Car
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot or passenger. At cloud sectors, power +1, may deploy as a 'react' and may move and be targeted by weapons like a starfighter. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Enclosed high altitude vehicle designed by Bespin Motors. Top speed of 1,500 kph. Repulsorlift drives and ion engines allow it to reach the upper atmosphere.

combo: Cloud Car + Power Harpoon Ground defense ability.
Cloud Car + Don't Underestimate Our Chances Deploy some Cloud Cars as 'react' to surprise you opponent.

front.title: Cloud City Blaster
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior at a Cloud City site. May target a character or creature using 2 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit (and may not be used to satisfy attrition) if destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Black market ties make it possible for the Cloud City quartermaster to acquire powerful weapons such as this. Low refraction index provides minimal beam dispersion.

front.title: •Cloud City Celebration
front.gametext: Deploy on Bespin system if you occupy at least two Cloud City battleground sites. During each of your control phases, retrieve 1 Force for each Cloud City battleground you occupy. Canceled if opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The merchants on Cloud City fear Imperial occupation. Many on the floating station long for the day that the Empire is overthrown.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Cloud City Sabacc
front.gametext: Requirements: a gambler, thief or smuggler on Cloud City. Wild cards (1-6): Lando and Weather Vane. Clone cards: Locations and Ugnaughts. (Gamblers may use clone cards as zeroes.) Stakes: One starfighter, weapon or device.
front.lore: The current administrator of Cloud City was rumored to have won his position by playing this version of sabacc.

combo: Cloud City Sabacc + Electrobinoculars Get a good start on your sabacc draw.

Cloud City Sabacc + R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo) If R2-D2 (Artoo-Detoo) is in your Reserve Deck, and you happen to draw him as part of your sabacc hand, you have a great option. As owner, you get to choose which number he uses for that draw.

front.title: •••Cloud City Technician
front.gametext: When present at a converted site, may use 2 Force to raise your site to the top. Also, when present at an opponent's site that has a Scomp link, your Force drains are +1 there.
front.lore: Former Imperial technician disenchanted with the New Order. Sympathetic to the Alliance. His knowledge of Imperial computer systems makes him a valuable ally.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Cloud City Trooper
front.gametext: Deploys only on Cloud City, but may move elsewhere. Power -1 when at a site other than a Cloud City site.
front.lore: Recently hired members of the Cloud City Wing Guard are less corrupt than those who served under past administrations. Most new recruits despise the Empire.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
combo: Cloud City Trooper + Lobot + Trooper Utris M'Toc. A force with a high forfeit that deploys for free.

front.title: •Cloud City: Carbonite Chamber
front.gametext: Light:  If you control, Force drain +1 here and may cancel Carbon- Freezing here.  Dark:  If you control, add 1 to your Carbon-Freezing destiny.

front.title: •Cloud City: Casino
front.gametext: Light:  Whenever your gambler present here wins Cloud City Sabacc, retrieve 2 Force (3 if Lando).  Dark:  Unless you have a gambler here, you may not use wild cards in Cloud City Sabacc.

front.title: •Cloud City: Chasm Walkway
front.gametext: Light:  If Weather Vane on table, characters 'hit' here are instead immediately relocated there.  Dark:  If Weather Vane on table, characters 'hit' here are instead immediately relocated there.

front.title: •Cloud City: Core Tunnel
front.gametext: Light:  Your aliens are power +1 here. If your Lando or your Lobot here, Force drain +1 here.  Dark:  Your aliens are forfeit -1 here. If your Lando or your Lobot here, Force drain +1 here.

front.title: •Cloud City: Downtown Plaza
front.gametext: Light:  Once during each of your control phases, may use 1 Force to retrieve one Cloud City location.  Dark:  If you control, opponent's Downtown Plaza game text is canceled.

front.title: •Cloud City: Guest Quarters
front.gametext: Light:  Leia is deploy -2 here.  Dark:  If you control, Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Cloud City: Incinerator
front.gametext: Light:  If you occupy, during your control phase, may use 3 Force to retrieve one droid.  Dark:  If you control without an Ugnaught, Force drain -1 here.

combo: Cloud City: Incinerator + EG-4 (Eegee-Four) + Off The Edge

front.title: •Cloud City: Lower Corridor
front.gametext: Light:  Your characters with lightsabers are each power +2 here.  Dark:  -

front.title: •Cloud City: North Corridor
front.gametext: Light:  If you control, once per turn may use 1 Force to cancel a Force drain at a Cloud City site.  Dark:  If you control, once per turn may use 2 Force to cancel a Force drain at a Cloud City site.

front.title: •Cloud City: Platform 327 (Docking Bay)
front.gametext: Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.  Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.

front.title: •Cloud City: Upper Plaza Corridor
front.gametext: Light:  During your move phase, you may move free between here and any Cloud City site.  Dark:  If you control, Force drain +1 here.

front.title: •Cloud City: West Gallery
front.gametext: Light:  Your blasters present may fire at targets at nearest related exterior site.  Dark:  Force drain -1 here.

front.title: <><><>Clouds
front.gametext: Light:  If you control, once per turn, may add 1 to a Force drain at a related site. Starships are power and maneuver -2 here.  Dark:  If you control, Force drain +1 here. Starships are power and maneuver -2 here.

combo: Clouds + Tibanna Gas Miner Add to Force drains at cloud sectors.
Clouds + Kebyc

front.title: Collision!
front.gametext: Use 1 Force if opponent has at least two starships present at same system or sector. Draw destiny. If destiny < number of those starships, opponent must lose one of them.
front.lore: High-speed collisions are a constant danger during chaotic starfighter dogfights. Scanners can be jammed. Pilots rely on vision, increasing the chances of such accidents.

front.title: •Colo Claw Fish
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Cancels Opee Sea Killer. While no card here, you may place a card from hand face-up here. If you just drew weapon or battle destiny, you may exchange it for card here, which then counts as that destiny draw. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The colo claw fish's front end is dominated by a large snout covered with two large eyes that can see deep into the murky depths. Able to survive due to its exceptional vision.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: After exchanging, the new destiny card is 'just drawn'.
After exchanging, the new destiny is not 'substituted'. It may be modified/canceled/reset and counts towards limits.
All modifiers transfer from the old destiny card to the new one.

front.title: •Colonel Cracken
front.gametext: Deploys -2 aboard Tala 1. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Tala 1, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. When opponent deploys a spy or scout to same (or related) exterior site, opponent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: Alliance spy and scout. Often flies support missions for General Madine's commandos.

combo: Colonel Cracken + Double Agent

front.title: •Colonel Feyn Gospic
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Power +2 on Yavin 4. When at Massassi War Room, doubles Rebel Tech bonus to Attack Run. While present with Rebel Planners, that Effect applies separately to every system and immune to Alter.
front.lore: One of General Dodonna's chief strategic advisors. Planned the Rebel fleet's approach to the Death Star.

front.title: •Colonel Salm
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When he is piloting a Y-wing, once per battle you may cancel and redraw your battle destiny just drawn. While he occupies the Renegade system, Imperial Control is flipped and Imperial Occupation may not be flipped.
front.lore: Leader of Gray Squadron. Prefers to fly venerable Koensayr starfighters instead of newer models because 'they've always gotten me home in one piece.'

rulings: May only cancel and redraw a battle destiny if he is participating in the battle.

front.title: Combined Attack
front.gametext: During a battle, target opponent's starship present with two (or more) of your starship weapons. Add all weapon destiny draws together. Apply that total separately for each weapon in an order of your choosing.
front.lore: Efficient cooperation allowed the Rebels to coordinate the attack of their small starfighters effectively at the Battle of Yavin.

front.title: •Combined Fleet Action
front.gametext: At each system where any player does not have both a starfighter and a capital starship present, that player's starships there are power -2. At sites related to systems you occupy, during each battle opponent may draw no more than one battle destiny. Once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one combat vehicle from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

front.title: •Commander Cody
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to same site as Obi-Wan. [Separatist] cards are power and defense value -1 here. When in battle at a site with Rex (or two of your clones), may cancel one just drawn battle destiny.
front.lore: Leader. Clone trooper.

combo: Commander Cody + Captain Rex

front.title: •Commander Evram Lajaie
front.gametext: When at a Yavin 4, Hoth or Endor site, Rebel starships may move to the related system as a 'react'.
front.lore: Popular leader whose expertise in space defense and orbital battle stations enabled the Alliance to uncover a fatal flaw in the Death Star's design.

front.title: •Commander Luke Skywalker
front.gametext: Deploys only on Hoth. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Rogue 1, also adds 2 to maneuver. Immune to attrition < 3. Adds 1 to forfeit of each other Rogue Squadron pilot or gunner at same Hoth site.
front.lore: Hero of Yavin. Promoted to Commander in his third year of military training with the Alliance. Squadron flight leader at Echo Base during the Battle of Hoth.

front.title: •Commander Luke Skywalker (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Rogue 1, it is maneuver +2 and Luke draws two battle destiny if unable to otherwise. During your control phase, may use 1 Force to take a speeder or a card with 'T-47' in game text into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Hero of Yavin. Promoted to Commander in his third year of military training with the Alliance. Squadron flight leader at Echo Base during the Battle of Hoth.

front.title: •Commander Narra
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. Once per turn, if you just deployed a Rogue Squadron pilot to same or related site, may draw top card of Reserve Deck. Attrition against opponent is +1 here.
front.lore: Rogue Squadron Leader

front.title: •Commander Ruescott Melshi
front.gametext: When deployed (or if just lost), may take Throw Me Another Charge or a trooper into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Opponent's troopers are power and forfeit -1 here. During any move phase, may use 2 Force to release an imprisoned captive here.
front.lore: Scout trooper.

front.title: •Commander Vanden Willard
front.gametext: When at a war room you control, adds 1 to power of each Rebel starship at the related system. May use 1 Force to cancel Astromech Shortage.
front.lore: Leader of Rebel forces on Yavin 4. Formerly Suolriep sector HQ commander. As a Rebel spy, aided Princess Leia and Bail Organa in the years prior to the Senate's dissolution.

combo: Commander Vanden Willard + Double Agent

front.title: •Commander Vanden Willard (V)
front.gametext: Alderaanian. Once per game, may place your just lost Alderaanian in Used Pile. Once per turn, if Stolen Data Tapes 'delivered,' a system 'liberated,' or Stardust on your spy, may place a card from hand on Used Pile to draw top card of Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Leader of Rebel forces on Yavin 4. Formerly Suolriep sector HQ commander. As a Rebel spy, aided Princess Leia and Bail Organa in the years prior to the Senate's dissolution.

front.title: •Commander Wedge Antilles
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Rogue 3, also adds 2 to maneuver and draws battle destiny if not able to otherwise. May use 2 Force to take one One More Pass into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Promoted to commander for his heroism in the Battle of Yavin. Leader in charge of training new pilots assigned to Echo Base. Piloted Rogue 3 in the battle of Hoth.

front.title: •Commander Wedge Antilles (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Rogue 3, it is maneuver +2 and your Force drains here are +1. While piloting a T-47, Wedge draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise and, if opponent draws more than one battle destiny here, may cancel one.
front.lore: Promoted to commander for his heroism in the Battle of Yavin. Leader in charge of training new pilots assigned to Echo Base. Piloted Rogue 3 in the battle of Hoth.

rulings: May cancel any opponent's battle destiny except the first one.

front.title: •Commando Training
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. Each of your non-unique Rebels armed with a non-unique blaster is forfeit +2, adds 1 to his total weapon destiny and, where present, cumulatively adds 1 to total battle destiny. (Immune to Alter while your non-unique blaster is on table.)
front.lore: Han's Rebel strike team on the forest moon of Endor was highly trained in the use of blasters and explosives.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •Commence Recharging
front.gametext: Deploy on a superlaser. May not fire at a planet until 'recharged.' Opponent may use Force (stacking it here); accumulating 8 Force recharges superlaser. When fired at a planet, Effect is canceled. If Effect canceled, accumulated Force is placed in Used Pile.
front.lore: The huge strain on the little-tested power generator matrix of the superlaser's fusion reactor can require full recharging before the system can be used again.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
rulings: Stack the 8 Force directly on Commence Recharging.
The X Force needed by Commence Primary Ignition must also still be paid as usual.

front.title: Computer Interface
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Limited Resources.  LOST: Use 2 Force (free if Lobot on table) to examine the top card of your Reserve Deck, Force Pile and Used Pile. Return one of those three cards to the top of each deck or pile.
front.lore: Lobot's direct link with the Cloud City central computer allowed him to efficiently manipulate the floating city's resources.

front.title: •Concentrate All Fire
front.gametext: Each starfighter that fires a weapon in battle is power +3 for the remainder of battle. Once per turn you may cancel and redraw your starship weapon destiny just drawn. At sites related to systems you occupy, your characters who have immunity to attrition each add 2 to immunity and 1 to each of that character's weapon destiny draws.

cancels: Your starship weapon destiny draw to cause a redraw

front.title: Concussion Grenade
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on your warrior. May 'throw' at same or adjacent site. Draw destiny. All characters, weapons and devices with that destiny number present at that site are lost. (Only your warrior is lost if destiny = 0.) Concussion Grenade also lost.
front.lore: Mier-Lan V-59 grenade. Blows stuff up.

combo: Concussion Grenade + Under Attack

front.title: Concussion Missiles
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your bomber, A-wing, freighter, or transport. May target a starship for free. Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a starfighter or squadron. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Used by veteran smugglers. Defend transports from maneuverable TIE fighters. Frequently used to arm Rebellion transports and freighters.

pulledBy: Lieutenant s'Too Vees (when at a docking bay)

front.title: Control
front.gametext: Cancel Sense or Alter. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel an Immediate or Mobile Effect (even if just deployed), or Force drain.
front.lore: Qui-Gon's sense of control assisted him in his final confrontation with Darth Maul. The ability to heal oneself in battle, mentally and physically, can be a huge advantage.

rulings: Can be played as a top-level action.
Can be played as a response to the attempted deployment of an Immediate or Mobile Effect, preventing any result.
Can be played as a response to the completed deployment of an Immediate or Mobile Effect, after it has any automatic results.

front.title: Control
front.gametext: Cancel one Sense or Alter card. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel one Immediate Effect, Mobile Effect or Force drain.
front.lore: Mystical Jedi power. Covers power of inner mind and body. Allows Jedi to exist in harmony with nature. You must learn this.

rulings: Can be played as a top-level action.
Can be played as a response to the attempted deployment of an Immediate or Mobile Effect, preventing any result.

front.title: Control & Tunnel Vision
front.gametext: Cancel one Sense or Alter card. (Immune to Sense.) OR Cancel one Immediate Effect, Mobile Effect, or Force drain. OR Take one card into hand from Force Pile; reshuffle.

rulings: Can be played as a top-level action.
Can be played as a response to the attempted deployment of an Immediate or Mobile Effect, preventing any result.

front.title: •Corellia
front.gametext: Light:  Your Falcon and your Corellian corvettes may deploy here as a 'react.'  Dark:  Each of your starships are hyperspeed +1 when moving from here.

combo: Corellia + Kessel Run Because of its low parsec number, Corellia makes an ideal planet to begin a Kessel Run from.

front.title: Corellia Operative
front.gametext: While at a Corellia site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is forfeit +1 (and power +1 if your Corellian is on Corellia) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Corellia from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Many of the Alliance's best engineers are sent to Corellia. The Rebellion maintains a presence on Corellia to ensure and assist in the production of the Alliance's starships.

pulledBy: Pucumir Thryss (to same Cloud City site)

front.title: •••Corellian
front.gametext: Once per turn, one weapon or device is deploy -1 onto a Rebel at same site.
front.lore: Brindy Truchong is a typical female Corellian smuggler. Her goal in Mos Eisley is to find a quick means of providing supplies to the Rebellion.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Corellian Corvette
front.gametext: May add 3 pilots, 4 passengers and 1 vehicle. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot aboard provides ability of 1.
front.lore: Multi-purpose Rebel Blockade Runner. Modular interior designed for troop or cargo transport. 150 meters long. Used by Rebels, pirates, corporations and the Empire.

front.title: •Corellian Engineering Corporation
front.gametext: Deploy on Corellia system. All your freighters are deploy -1 and hyperspeed +1. Also, all your Quad Laser Cannons deploy free and add 2 to each of their weapon destiny draws. Suspended while opponent controls Corellia. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Only one of the 'Big Three' starship manufacturers to sell primarily to civilians. CEC employees take great delight in calling their highly modifiable designs 'stock'.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Corellian Retort
front.gametext: USED: Search your Reserve Deck, take one Captive Fury or Captive Pursuit into hand and reshuffle.  LOST: If a bounty hunter (or gangster) and Han are involved in the same battle, you may add one battle destiny (add two if gangster is Jabba).
front.lore: 'Threepio, you tell that slimy piece of worm-ridden filth he'll get no such pleasure from us!'

combo: Corellian Retort + Han Solo + Solo Han + Warrior's Courage

front.title: Corellian Slip
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a Tallon Roll, add your maneuver + ability of one pilot on you targeted starfighter to your total. OR Decrease the maneuver of an opponent's starfighter by 1 for remainder of this turn.
front.lore: First perfected by Corellian starship battle tacticians, this dangerous counter-maneuver has saved numerous hot-shot pilots in life-or-death situations.

front.title: Corellian Slip (V)
front.gametext: During battle, target opponent's starfighter with your snub fighter. Starfighter's gametext (except related to any capacity and the ability and identity of any permanent pilots) is canceled. OR If your pilot of ability < 3 was just lost from aboard a snub fighter, take pilot into hand.
front.lore: First perfected by Corellian starship battle tacticians, this dangerous counter-maneuver has saved numerous hot-shot pilots in life-or-death situations.

front.title: •Corporal Beezer
front.gametext: Prevents opponent from 'reacting' to same site. Once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one device to same location from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Rebels of ability < 3 and [Endor] Rebels are immune to Scanning Crew.
front.lore: Alderaanian slicer and technician. Trained by Brooks Carlson to serve as a Scout for Alliance commandos. She gets nervous when General Solo tries to hotwire something.

rulings: The device may deploy on (for example) a character at the location.

front.title: •Corporal Delevar
front.gametext: Prevents your characters from having their forfeit reduced at same location (and at Hoth sites if Delevar is at Echo Med Lab). When with your FX droid, once per turn allows your character just forfeited from same site to be placed in Used Pile.
front.lore: Veteran of Battle of Hoth. Medic and Scout assigned to General Solo's assault force. Prides himself on being an efficient soldier in General Madine's commando organization.

front.title: •Corporal Delevar (V)
front.gametext: Once per game, may deploy 2-1B here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if present at a site, may 'operate' on your Disarmed character (or your just 'hit' non-droid character of ability < 4) present here; character is restored to normal.
front.lore: Veteran of Battle of Hoth. Medic and Scout assigned to General Solo's assault force. Prides himself on being an efficient soldier in General Madine's commando organization.

front.title: •Corporal Janse
front.gametext: When firing a character weapon, adds 1 to each weapon destiny draw. When Janse fires an A280 Sharpshooter Rifle at a character at an adjacent site and is using Sorry About The Mess, it is a Used Interrupt.
front.lore: Sharpshooter from Ukio. Recently joined the Alliance. Former BlasTech employee who evaluated new weapon designs. Served as a Scout on hunting expeditions.

combo: Corporal Janse + A280 Sharpshooter Rifle + Firefight
Corporal Janse + A280 Sharpshooter Rifle + Sorry About The Mess

front.title: •Corporal Kensaric
front.gametext: When present at an exterior site battleground site with your other scout, adds 2 (or 1 if Goo Nee Tay on table) to deploy cost of opponent's characters, vehicles and starships to same site.
front.lore: Scout responsible for covering the tracks of General Solo's strike team. Served under Bren Derlin during the Battle of Hoth.

combo: Corporal Kensaric + Goo Nee Tay

front.title: •Corporal Marmor
front.gametext: Reduces X by 3 on Docking And Repair Facilities when a Star Cruiser is held there. When he is at a docking bay where you have just deployed a starfighter, once per turn you may retrieve 1 Force.
front.lore: Corellian dock mechanic. Defected to the Alliance with General Madine. Manages staff of 75 starfighter and 12 star cruiser mechanics in Home One's rear quadrant.

combo: Corporal Marmor + Docking And Repair Facilities

front.title: •Corporal Midge
front.gametext: Adds 1 to each of his character weapon destiny draws (2 when firing a rifle and all your ability here is provided by scouts). While on Endor, adds 1 to your Force drains at your exterior Endor sites where you have a scout of ability > 2 (and no Ewoks).
front.lore: Self-taught marksman and Scout from a rural region of Chandrila. Inspired by Mon Mothma to join the Alliance. Newly recruited into Madine's commandos as a field technician.

front.title: •Corporal Rushing
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. While firing a blaster, adds one to total weapon destiny. Once per battle, if a battle droid was just hit by a blaster here, battle droid is lost and opponent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: Royal Naboo security officer in charge of protecting Amidala's Throne Room. His wife and children were captured when the Trade Federation invaded the planet.

front.title: •Corran Horn
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power and 2 to maneuver of anything he pilots. During your move phase, may use 1 Force to 'break cover' of opponent's Undercover spy at same site. Power +3 in battle against opponent's spy or bounty hunter. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Corellian. Former counter-intelligence agent and spy for CorSec (Corellian Security). Gifted tactician. One of Wedge Antilles' best pilots. Member of Rogue Squadron.

combo: Corran Horn + Double Agent
Corran Horn + Red 6 (or any other spy with pilot ability) Deploy Corran Horn on Red 6 to any system even without presece or Force icons.

front.title: •Corran Horn In Rogue 9
front.gametext: Permanent pilot is •Corran Horn, who provides ability of 4. Weapon destiny draws are -2 here. While with a snub fighter, attrition against opponent is +1 here. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Corulag
front.gametext: Light:  If you control, all non-unique Rebels are power and forfeit +1 and Rebel guards may move.  Dark:  If you control, Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Coruscant
front.gametext: Light:  If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Coruscant sites.  Dark:  If you control, for each of your starships here, your total power is +1 in battles at Coruscant sites.

front.title: •Coruscant
front.gametext: Light:  Force drain +1 here. If Rebels control this system, Imperials and Imperial starships are deploy +2.  Dark:  Your starships and pilots deploy -2 here.

front.title: •Coruscant Celebration
front.gametext: Deploy on Coruscant system if you occupy at least two Coruscant battleground sites. During each of your control phases, retrieve 1 Force for each Coruscant battleground you occupy. Canceled if opponent controls this system. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Despite Imperial propaganda, the citizens of Coruscant very much wish for the collapse of the Empire.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: Coruscant Guard
front.gametext: Once per turn, may use 1 Force to add 2 to politics of one of your senators present for remainder of turn. While present at Galactic Senate, all characters without politics here are forfeit = 0 (except Coruscant Guards).
front.lore: Highly trained guard personnel play a valuable role in protecting the various dignitaries and political figures that frequently have business to attend to on Coruscant.

front.title: •Coruscant: Docking Bay
front.gametext: Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.  Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.

front.title: •Coruscant: Galactic Senate
front.gametext: Light:  During battles here, a character's power is equal to that character's politics.  Dark:  During battles here, a character's power is equal to that character's politics.

combo: Coruscant: Galactic Senate + Plead My Case To The Senate + Sanity And Compassion

front.title: •Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber
front.gametext: Light:  [Episode I] Yoda may deploy here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Immune to Revolution.  Dark:  Non-unique lightsaber Force drain bonuses everywhere are canceled.

combo: Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber + Plead My Case To The Senate Objective
Coruscant: Jedi Council Chamber + Speak With The Jedi Council

front.title: •Coruscant: Night Club
front.gametext: Light:  Your characters here are defense value -1 and may not be excluded from battle.  Dark:  Your characters here are defense value -1 and may not be excluded from battle.

front.title: •Count Me In
front.gametext: Deploy on Leia if That's One is on table. I Know is a Used Interrupt. Once per battle, when Leia is battling with Han and Chewie and you are about to draw a card for battle or weapon destiny, you may instead use Leia's ability number.
front.lore: Leia couldn't let Han out of her sight.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •Courage Of A Skywalker
front.gametext: One of your Skywalkers present during a battle at a site, for remainder of turn, loses immunity to attrition but adds ability to power (he or she may not apply ability toward drawing battle destiny). OR During a duel, add one destiny to your total.
front.lore: Despite being alone, trapped and desperately outmatched, Luke continued his battle with the Dark Lord of the Sith.

combo: Courage Of A Skywalker + Draw Their Fire + Treva Home (Psychobabble)

front.title: •Covert Landing
front.gametext: USED: If your shuttle (including a shuttle vehicle) is in battle, add one battle destiny.  LOST: If your starfighter just landed at a site where opponent has no presence, deploy scouts (and weapons on those scouts) aboard it (capacity permitting) from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: The stolen code allowed the Rebels to land their strike team on the Endor surface undetected - or so they thought.

combo: Covert Landing + Luminous
rulings: The USED function works even if the shuttle (or shuttle vehicle) is landed or unpiloted.

front.title: Crack Shot
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on table. Any card which is 'hit' may not be used to satisfy attrition. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Imperial recruits are repeatedly assured that small cracks between the plates of their armor pose little risk from laser fire. Their first day of battle often tells a different story.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Crash Site Memorial
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. If you just lost a vehicle, droid, weapon, or device, may stack it here. Once during your deploy phase, you may exchange any one card in hand with one card stacked here. Any cards stacked here are considered 'supporting.'
front.lore: Mos Eisley was built around wreckage of the colony ship Dowager Queen. The wreck remains as a monument where residents leave junk for Jawa scavengers.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
canceledBy: Turn It Off! Turn It Off!

front.title: •Credits Will Do Fine
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on table. If you just initiated a Force drain (or won a battle) at Watto's Junkyard, opponent loses 1 Force (cannot be reduced) and stacks lost card here face down. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'No, they won't!'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Credits Will Do Fine + I Feel The Conflict + Draw Their Fire
Credits Will Do Fine + Master Qui-Gon (V)
rulings: If a player loses Force from hand to stack here, it is first revealed to both players.
If a player loses Force from Life Force to stack here, it is not revealed.
Text referring to cards stacked 'on'/'under'/'beneath' this Effect all means the same thing.

front.title: •Critical Error Revealed
front.gametext: If you have a leader at your war room, peek at the top card of opponent's Reserve Deck. You may place it on bottom of that Reserve Deck.
front.lore: Hologram technology allows efficient communication of complex intelligence during war room briefings.

front.title: •Crusher Roodown
front.gametext: Power -3 with Unkar Plutt. Once per battle, may use 1 Force to peek at cards stacked on Graveyard Of Giants; place one in owner's Lost Pile to add one destiny to total power at same or adjacent site. May take your starship just drawn for destiny into hand.
front.lore: Abednedo scavenger.

front.title: •CT-5385 (Tup)
front.gametext: During any move phase, may fire a weapon at an Undercover spy. Permanent weapon is Clone Snipe Rifle (may target a character or vehicle for free; draw destiny; target hit if destiny +2 > defense value).
front.lore: Clone trooper.

front.title: •CT-5555 (Fives)
front.gametext: Once per turn, if you just drew a destiny of 5, may take that card into hand. During any deploy phase, may use 1 Force to target a Dark Jedi present. Draw destiny. If destiny = 5, target loses immunity to attrition for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Clone trooper and spy.

combo: Commander Cody + Captain Rex + CT-5555 (Fives)

front.title: •Cyborg Construct
front.gametext: Deploy on an alien of ability < 3. Each turn, you may 'store' one card from hand face-down here. Holds up to three cards (six on Lobot). You may play or deploy cards from here as if from hand. Place stored cards in Used Pile if device lost or removed from character.
front.lore: Biotech's latest model, the Aj^g, boasts greater storage capacity than all other models combined. Advertised as, 'Artificial intelligence worth shaving your head for.'

rulings: If stolen, place the previous owner's cards underneath in the owner's Used Pile.

front.title: •Cyborg Construct (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on an alien of ability < 3. While at a Scomp link, Computer Interface is a Used Interrupt, and once per turn may use 1 Force to take Computer Interface into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once per turn, if on Lobot, may deploy a trooper here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Biotech's latest model, the Aj^g, boasts greater storage capacity than all other models combined. Advertised as, 'Artificial intelligence worth shaving your head for.'

front.title: CZ-3 (Seezee-Three)
front.gametext: If opponent has just initiated a battle or Force drain at CZ-3's location or an adjacent site, you may 'react' by deploying cards (at normal use of the Force) to that battle or Force drain location.
front.lore: CZ comm droid built by Serv-O-Droid. Outdated but still commonly in use. Built-in comlink. Sophisticated scramblers and encryption programming.

combo: CZ-3 (Seezee-Three) + Rebel Trooper +  Rebel Guard

front.title: •Dack Ralter
front.gametext: Adds 1 to weapon destiny draws of anything he is aboard as a passenger (adds 3 if aboard Rogue 1 or with Luke).
front.lore: Born in an Imperial labor camp on Kalist 6. Joined the Rebellion after his escape. Young student of Commander Skywalker. Experienced crackshot gunner.

front.title: •Dagobah
front.gametext: Light:  During your deploy phase, you may deploy one Dagobah site directly from Reserve Deck. Shuffle, cut and replace.  Dark:  Neither player may Force drain here.

front.title: •Dagobah: Bog Clearing
front.gametext: Light:  Your starfighters may deploy here and immune to Awwww, Cannot Get Your Ship Out here.  Dark:  If you occupy, Force generation +1 for you here.

rulings: Starfighters with permanent pilots may deploy here.
Unpiloted starfighters may deploy here empty.
Unpiloted starfighters may deploy here simultaneously with a pilot character only if that character was already permitted to deploy to Dagobah.

front.title: •Dagobah: Jungle
front.gametext: Light:  No starships or vehicles here. Your creatures are deploy -2 here.  Dark:  No starships or vehicles here. If you occupy, Force generation +1 for you here.

front.title: •Dagobah: Swamp
front.gametext: Light:  At end of your turn, your starships and vehicles here 'sink' to Used Pile.  Dark:  At end of your turn, your starships and vehicles here 'sink' to bottom of Lost Pile.

front.title: •Dagobah: Training Area
front.gametext: Light:  Once per turn, may search Reserve Deck. Take one Jedi Test into hand. Reshuffle deck.  Dark:  You may use 1 Force to cancel any Force drain here.

pulls: It Is The Future You See

front.title: •Dagobah: Yoda's Hut
front.gametext: Light:  If Yoda here, once per turn, may subtract 2 from attrition against you at another location.  Dark:  If you occupy, opponent's Yoda's Hut game text is canceled.

front.title: •Dams Denna
front.gametext: Once during your deploy phase, you may deploy a Kaadu, Fambaa or Eopie to same site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. If you just lost a creature vehicle from same site, you may place that creature in your Used Pile.
front.lore: Knowledgable animal trainer and herd-master. Collector of Linn'con memorabilia.

front.title: •Dantooine
front.gametext: Light:  Your capital starships deploy -2 and your starfighters deploy -1 here.  Dark:  If you control, Force drain +1 here.

front.title: Dantooine Base Operations / More Dangerous Than You Realize
front.gametext: Dantooine Base Operations:Deploy Dantooine system.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy from Reserve Deck to Dantooine one site or non-unique Rebel; reshuffle. At Dantooine locations, each Imperial is deploy +2.{Flip} this card if Rebels control at least three Dantooine sites and opponent controls no Dantooine locations.{Place} out of play if Dantooine is 'blown away.'More Dangerous Than You Realize:{While} this side up, opponent's Force drains are -1. At Dantooine locations, each Imperial is deploy +2. Your squadrons may deploy to Dantooine (deploy cost = squadron's power -3), are immune to attrition < 4 and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Your Force drains are +1 at systems where you have a squadron present.{Flip} this card if opponent controls at least two Dantooine locations.{Place} out of play if Dantooine is 'blown away.'

back.title: Dantooine Base Operations / More Dangerous Than You Realize
back.gametext: Dantooine Base Operations:Deploy Dantooine system.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy from Reserve Deck to Dantooine one site or non-unique Rebel; reshuffle. At Dantooine locations, each Imperial is deploy +2.{Flip} this card if Rebels control at least three Dantooine sites and opponent controls no Dantooine locations.{Place} out of play if Dantooine is 'blown away.'More Dangerous Than You Realize:{While} this side up, opponent's Force drains are -1. At Dantooine locations, each Imperial is deploy +2. Your squadrons may deploy to Dantooine (deploy cost = squadron's power -3), are immune to attrition < 4 and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. Your Force drains are +1 at systems where you have a squadron present.{Flip} this card if opponent controls at least two Dantooine locations.{Place} out of play if Dantooine is 'blown away.'

rulings: The word 'squadron' here refers only to squadron-class starship cards, not (for example) 'Red Squadron 7'.
Squadron deploy cost considers global modifiers to power like S-foils.
Squadron deploy cost may not be directly modified, such as by Haven.

front.title: •Dark Approach
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle, you may do one of the following: Add one destiny to power only. OR If you have a character weapon present, select one opponent's character present to lose all immunity to attrition for remainder of battle.
front.lore: 'The Force is with you, young Skywalker. But you are not a Jedi yet.'

front.title: Dark Dissension
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Dark Collaboration or Lone Pilot.  LOST: If two Imperials each with ability > 2 are in a battle together, use 2 Force to draw two destiny. Subtract that amount from opponent's attrition and total power (cannot fall below zero).
front.lore: The huge Imperial officers corps, with its high rate of turnover, is ripe with competitiveness and ambition. Advancement comes at the expense of another's career.

front.title: •Darklighter Spin
front.gametext: During a battle at a system or sector, if you are about to draw a card for battle destiny, you may instead use the maneuver number of your starfighter in that battle.
front.lore: Biggs improvised this maneuver shortly after joining the Alliance. By spinning his starfighter while firing all four cannons, he was able to destroy multiple incoming targets.

front.title: •Darth Maul's Demise
front.gametext: If your [Episode I] Jedi just defeated Maul in lightsaber combat, draw destiny. Add 2 if Qui-Gon out of play. If total > 6, place Maul out of play and you may search your Lost Pile and take any one card into hand. (Immune to Sense.)
front.lore: Despite coming face to face with the first Sith to be seen in a millennia, the young Padawan was still a force to be reckoned with.

front.title: •Dash
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to increase a character's or creature vehicle's landspeed by 1 for remainder of turn. OR Use 3 Force to move one of your characters as a 'react' (free if character is a scout).
front.lore: See Luke run. Run Luke, run!

front.title: •Dash in Rogue 12
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot. Permanent pilot is •Dash, who provides ability of 3. During battle, if with another T-47 and about to draw battle destiny, may draw two and choose one. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Enclosed.

combo: This card gains immune to attrtion < 6 from Echo Base Garrison

front.title: •Dash Rendar
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Outrider, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise, and once per battle, may reduce power of one opponent's starship in same battle by power of Outrider for remainder of battle.
front.lore: Emperor banished Rendar family from Coruscant. Became gambler and smuggler. Brought down AT-AT at the Battle of Hoth. Works for Rebel Alliance from time to time. Corellian.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
combo: Dash Rendar + Outrider + Moving To Attack Position

front.title: •Dash Rendar (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. May move as a 'react'. When in battle with Leebo (or opponent's gangster, [Permanent Weapon] card, or [Maintenance] card), may draw one destiny; subtract that amount from opponent's total power and attrition.
front.lore: Emperor banished Rendar family from Coruscant. Became gambler and smuggler. Brought down AT-AT at the Battle of Hoth. Works for Rebel Alliance from time to time. Corellian.

front.title: •Daughter Of Skywalker
front.gametext: Deploys -3 on Tydirium, Endor or Dagobah. May be deployed instead of Luke by Mind What You Have Learned (that card then targets Leia instead of Luke for remainder of game). While at any exterior site, adds one Light side icon. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Scout. Leader. Made friends with Wicket. Negotiated an alliance with the Ewoks. Leia found out the truth about her father from Luke in the Ewok village.

combo: Daughter Of Skywalker + Jerus Jannick
Daughter Of Skywalker + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.

front.title: •Daughter Of Skywalker (V)
front.gametext: While at an Endor site, adds one [Light Side] icon here. During battle, may target one opponent's character present. Draw destiny. If destiny > ability, target is power -2 and its game text is canceled. Your scouts here are immune to Sniper, You Are Beaten, and attrition < 4.
front.lore: Scout. Leader. Made friends with Wicket. Negotiated an alliance with the Ewoks. Leia found out the truth about her father from Luke in the Ewok village.

rulings: The immunity she grants to scouts applies to herself.

'Immune to Sniper' prevents the control phase sniping function and prevents the place in Lost Pile function of the combo card. It does not prevent the 3 being added to weapon destiny function of the combo card.

front.title: Deactivate The Shield Generator
front.gametext: Deploy on Bunker. Once during your control phase, if you control Bunker with a Rebel, you may attempt to 'blow away' Bunker as follows: Charges! Come On, Come On!: Draw two destiny. Add 3 to total for each Explosive Charge on Bunker. Move! Move! Move!: If total destiny > 12, your characters here may relocate to Back Door for free, Bunker and Landing Platform (if on table) are 'blown away,' opponent loses 8 Force and this card is lost.

combo: Deactivate The Shield Generator+ Major Hewex
Deactivate The Shield Generator + Throw Me Another Charge Adds 1 to Deactivate The Shield Generator total.

front.title: •Death Star
front.gametext: Light:  Deploy if Death Star Plans completed and and Death Star system not on table. If 'blown away,' Dark Side loses 8 Force.  Dark:  X = parsec of current position (starts at 0). Immune to Revolution. You may move Death Star (hyperspeed = 1).

front.title: •Death Star Plans
front.gametext: Deploy on any Death Star site(except docking bay). Target one of your droids(not on Death Star). When target reaches Utinni Effect, 'steal' plans. If target then moves to any Yavin 4 site, draw 3 destiny. Retrieve that much lost Force. Lose Utinni Effect.
front.lore: 'What's so important? What's he carrying?' 'The technical readouts of that battle station. I only hope that when the data is analyzed, a weakness can be found.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
canceledBy: Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down

front.title: •Death Star: Detention Block Control Room
front.gametext: Light:  If you control, Force Drain +1 here and all imprisoned characters on Death Star are released.  Dark:  -

cards.counterpart: Death Star: Detention Block Control Room

front.title: •Death Star: Detention Block Corridor
front.gametext: Light:  Force drain +1 here. Whenever you release a captive here, retrieve 1 Force (4 if Leia).  Dark:  During your deploy phase, IT-O and Hypo may deploy here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.

front.title: •Death Star: Docking Bay 327
front.gametext: Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.  Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.

front.title: •Death Star: Level 6 Core Shaft Corridor
front.gametext: Light:  If you control, Luke and Obi-Wan are power +2 on Death Star.  Dark:  If you control, opponent needs 2 ability to control each Death Star site.

front.title: •Death Star: Trash Compactor
front.gametext: Light:  You may deploy here without presence. If you control, Force drain +1 here.  Dark:  (none).

front.title: •Death Star: Trench
front.gametext: Light:  'Trench Rules' in effect and each of your starfighters is maneuver - 2 here.  Dark:  'Trench Rules' in effect, your weapons fire free and Turbolaser Battery may deploy here.

combo: Death Star: Trench + Tight Squeeze

front.title: •Debnoli
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When firing a character weapon, adds 1 to total weapon destiny and characters he 'hits' are forfeit=0. Immune to attrition < 2 (< 5 while armed with a blaster).
front.lore: Good-natured patron of Mos Eisley cantina, until the Empire impounded his starship. Expert marksman. Seeking revenge on the Empire.

front.title: •Defiance
