back.gametext: Jabba's Prize is a Light Side card and does not count toward your deck limit. Reveal to opponent when deploying your Starting Effect. For remainder of game, you may not deploy [Maintenance] Falcon. {Deploys only at start of game if Jabba's Prize is at Security Tower (replaces opponent's Jabba's Prize imprisoned in Security Tower); otherwise place out of play.} May not be placed in Reserve Deck. Jabba's Prize is a persona of Corran Horn only while on table. If Jabba's Prize was just released or leaves table, place it out of play. While Jabba's Prize at Audience Chamber, opponent's battle destiny draws there are +1.

rulings: If Light includes this card, they must reveal it when it is time to deploy their Starting Effect and must then follow the instructions.

If Light plays You Can Either Profit By This... and Dark plays Carbon Chamber Testing with Jabba's Prize, Jabba's Prize (V) will start in the Security Tower and Light will have their Han card start at Audience Chamber.

front.title: •Jakku
front.gametext: Light:  If [Episode VII] Falcon here, Force drain +1 here.  Dark:  Imperial starships deploy +1 here.

front.title: •Jakku: Docking Bay
front.gametext: Light:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 1 Force.  Dark:  Your docking bay transit from here requires 2 Force.

front.title: •Jakku: Niima Outpost Shipyard
front.gametext: Light:  Your starfighters take off and land here for free.  Dark:  Your gangsters and scavengers deploy -1 here.

front.title: •Jakku: Ravager Crash Site
front.gametext: Light:  At the start of your turn, may stack top card of Lost Pile face down on Graveyard Of Giants.  Dark:  Unless opponent's scavenger present, opponent's Ravager Crash Site game text is canceled.

front.title: •Jakku: Rey's Encampment
front.gametext: Light:  Once per game, may deploy Rey here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Rey deploys -2 here.  Dark:  If Rey present, she may not be targeted by weapons.

front.title: •Jakku: Starship Graveyard
front.gametext: Light:  If you just deployed a scavenger here, may retrieve a device, droid, or weapon.  Dark:  Unless you occupy, your non-scavenger characters deploy and move to here for +1 Force.

front.title: •Jakku: Tuanul Village
front.gametext: Light:  Lor San Tekka is power +4 and defense value -2 here.  Dark:  If your First Order character here, your total power here is +2.

front.title: •Jar Jar Binks
front.gametext: May deploy to any site, even without presence or Force icons. During battle may use 1 Force to target one opponent's character present. Both players draw destiny. If your destiny + 2 > opponent's destiny + target's ability, Jar Jar and target are lost.
front.lore: Young Otolla Gungan. Clumsy. Outcast from Otoh Gunga for continually making mistakes that placed other members of Gungan society at risk.

combo: Jar Jar Binks + Brisky Morning Munchen
Jar Jar Binks + Wesa Gotta Grand Army Make opponent's undercover spy lost.

front.title: •Jar Jar's Electropole
front.gametext: Deploys on Jar Jar. May 'throw' (place in Used Pile) to target a character, creature or vehicle. Draw destiny. If destiny +2 > defense value, target is landspeed = 0 and power -2 for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Jar Jar had to be instructed on how to use an electropole prior to the battle on the great grass plains. It's not his weapon of choice.

front.title: Jawa
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. *To deploy, requires 1 Force from each players' Force Pile. Power +1 on Tatooine. While with another Jawa, if opponent just initiated a Force drain at adjacent site, may use 2 Force to reduce it by 1.
front.lore: Always on the prowl, Jawas work hard for every credit they earn.

pulledBy: Aved Luun to deploy to same location
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
rulings: Opponent's use of Force to deploy this card is mandatory.
May not be deployed if either player cannot pay.
Anything that modifies or resets the deploy cost affects the cost for both players.
If game text is canceled, the asterisk is treated as an unmodifiable zero.

front.title: Jawa
front.gametext: *To deploy, requires 1 Force from each players' Force Pile. Cannot deploy otherwise. Deploy only on Tatooine, but may move elsewhere.
front.lore: Pesky scavenger species. One meter tall. Trade language nearly unintelligible...unless Jawas wish to be understood. Sometimes build massive stone fortresses.

pulledBy: Aved Luun to deploy to same location
Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere
rulings: Opponent's use of Force to deploy this card is mandatory.
May not be deployed if either player cannot pay.
Anything that modifies or resets the deploy cost affects the cost for both players.
If game text is canceled, the asterisk is treated as an unmodifiable zero.

front.title: Jawa Ion Gun
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on your Jawa, 3 on your warrior. May target a character using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Targeted droid stolen if destiny +1 > forfeit. Targeted non-droid character excluded from battle if destiny = defense value.
front.lore: Cobbled-together weapon built from salvaged power cells, droid restraining bolts and an ion accelerator. Fires a stream of ion energy that stuns droids and irritates others.

combo: Jawa Ion Gun + R'kik D'nec, Hero Of The Dune Sea

front.title: •Jawa Siesta
front.gametext: To deploy (on your side of table), requires 3 Force from both players' Force Piles. Cannot deploy otherwise. All your Jawas are forfeit +1.
front.lore: Three Jawas take a cool, energy-saving nap in the noon-day suns at Mos Eisley.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Jawa Siesta + Kalit
Jawa Siesta + Draw Their Fire

front.title: •Jedi Business
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Non-[Episode I] Jedi are lost. Qui-Gon is deploy -1. Unless with Anakin or Vader, Mace is immune to attrition. Once per turn, may choose: deploy an [Episode I] lightsaber from Reserve Deck (reshuffle), or once per game, deploy Malastare, Mos Espa, or Night Club from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter)
front.lore: The peacekeepers of the galaxy are not to be taken lightly.

front.title: •Jedi Escape
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a duel against one of your non-captive Jedi at a site, use 1 Force to cancel the duel and you may relocate any number of your characters there to an adjacent site.
front.lore: Qui-Gon escaped with his friends from Tatooine, barely getting away from the clutches of Darth Maul.

front.title: •Jedi Leap
front.gametext: During your deploy phase, lose 1 Force to relocate [Episode I] Obi- Wan to an adjacent Naboo site. OR Raise your converted interior Theed Palace site to the top.
front.lore: Obi-Wan's youth combined with his Jedi training meant that he was not to be dispatched easily.

front.title: Jedi Levitation
front.gametext: Use X force, where X=(7- ability of your highest ability character on table). Search through your Used Pile and take one card into hand. Shuffle, Cut and replace.
front.lore: A Jedi can adjust the force within and around an object, causing it to move as the Jedi wills.

front.title: Jedi Levitation (V)
front.gametext: USED: If you just drew a character for destiny, take that card into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny.  LOST: Use 3 Force to retrieve a non-[Maintenance] character into hand.
front.lore: A Jedi can adjust the Force within and around an object, causing it to move as the Jedi wills.

front.title: Jedi Lightsaber
front.gametext: Use X Force to deploy on your warrior where X = (7 - warrior's ability). May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature by using X Force. Draw two destiny. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Elegant sword of pure energy. 'This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster. A lightsaber can be dangerous to an unskilled user.'

pulledBy: Jedi Master when lightsaber is in Lost Pile

front.title: Jedi Lightsaber (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on your character of ability > 4 or Padawan. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and may not be used to satisfy attrition, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Elegant sword of pure energy. 'This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster. A lightsaber can be dangerous to an unskilled user.'

front.title: •Jedi Mind Trick
front.gametext: USED: Cancel a Force drain at a site if Luke is at an adjacent site.  LOST: If your character of ability > 4 is present with an opponent's leader, release a captive from a related prison (canceled if opponent loses 2 Force).
front.lore: 'You will bring Captain Solo and the Wookiee to me.'

cancels: A Force drain at a site if Luke is at an adjacent site

front.title: •Jedi Mind Trick (V)
front.gametext: USED: If opponent just initiated a battle or Force drain, they must use 2 Force, or it is canceled.  LOST: If your Jedi in battle (unless with a Dark Jedi, Hutt, or Toydarian), 'wave hand at' (add or subtract 2 from) an opponent's just drawn destiny.
front.lore: 'You will bring Captain Solo and the Wookiee to me.'

front.title: Jedi Presence
front.gametext: If one of your Jedi is present during any battle, use 1 Force to cause all other Rebels there to battle at double power.
front.lore: Jedi Knights inspired allies on the battlefield through bravery and heroism. Obi-Wan's presence encouraged the Rebels and gave them a chance to escape the Death Star.

combo: Jedi Presence + Draw Their Fire + Treva Home (Psychobabble)

front.title: •Jek Porkins
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 6, also adds 1 to maneuver and draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise.
front.lore: Piloted Red 6 at Battle of Yavin. Specializes in strafing runs. Served in Tierfon Yellow Aces squadron at Tierfon Rebel Outpost. Free trader from Bestine system.

front.title: •Jeroen Webb
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When in battle with a Rebel leader, subtracts 1 from opponent's total battle destiny.
front.lore: Native of Ralltiir. Spy for Ralltiir's underground network after his homeworld was subjugated.

combo: Jeroen Webb + Zutton + any Rebel leader
Jeroen Webb + Double Agent

front.title: •Jerus Jannick
front.gametext: Deploys - 2 to same site as Amidala. While in a battle with Amidala or Leia, your leaders present may not be targeted by weapons, and Jerus may be forfeited to satisfy all battle damage and attrition against you.
front.lore: Part of Amidala's Royal Naboo Security Forces, Jerus has been trained as a protector of royalty, and is determined that his responsibility be carried out professionally.

combo: Jerus Jannick + Queen Amidala
Jerus Jannick + Queen Amidala, Ruler Of Naboo

front.title: •Jess
front.gametext: May retrieve 1 Force each time you deploy a musician to same site. During your turn, may use 1 Force to 'charm' one male alien of ability < 3 present; that male is forfeit = 0 for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Popular musician. Often seen with Bib Fortuna. Captivates those around her. Hoping to join a band and leave Jabba's palace.

front.title: •Joh Yowza
front.gametext: Power +2 on Endor or when present with your musician. When opponent draws destiny, Joh may 'jam' (place that card face down under Joh). Holds one card at a time. If Joh leaves table, place card under Joh in opponent's Used Pile.
front.lore: Yuzzum musician and thief. Singer for The Max Rebo Band. Stage name given to him by Sy Snootles. Jabba likes his performance, even though the Hutt despises Yuzzum.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: <>Jungle
front.gametext: Light:  Your aliens and creature vehicles are each power +1 here. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine.  Dark:  Force drain -1 here. Your attrition against opponent is -2 here. May not be deployed to Bespin, Coruscant, Hoth, Kessel or Tatooine.

front.title: •Jyn Erso
front.gametext: May deploy to a site as an Undercover spy. Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. If just lost, may peek at opponent's hand.
front.lore: Female Spy.

rulings: Text to 'draw one battle destiny if unable to otherwise' does not work while Jyn is Undercover.

front.title: •K-2SO (Kay-Tuesso)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise. While with Cassian, attrition against opponent is +1 here. If just lost, place out of play; if lost from a site, opponent may not move from there for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Spy.

pulledBy: I've Got A Bad Feeling About

front.title: •K-3PO (Kay-Threepio)
front.gametext: May initiate battle and be battled. K-3PO is power +1 for each of your other droids at same Hoth or Yavin 4 site. Functions as a leader if present with another of your droids.
front.lore: Old-model protocol droid. Learned military tactics while under the ownership of Commander Narra. In charge of the droid pool at Echo Base. May initiate battle and be battled.

front.title: Kaadu
front.gametext: May add 1 'rider' (passenger). Ability = 1/2. Moves for free. While 'ridden' by a Gungan, may move as a 'react.' While at a swamp, adds 1 to your Force drains there.
front.lore: Used by many Gungan warriors due to their fearless nature. Kaadu lay large numbers of eggs to compensate for those eaten by predators.

front.title: •Kabe
front.gametext: During your control phase, may target one opponent's weapon or device at same site. Draw destiny. If destiny < target's destiny number, Kabe 'steals' device to use, or weapon to hold and transfer (for free) to a warrior at same site.
front.lore: Young female Chadra-Fan. Thief. Guardian is Muftak. Abandoned on Tatooine by slavers. Loves intoxicating juri juice. Once robbed Jabba the Hutt's dwelling in Mos Eisley.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: •Kal'Falnl C'ndros
front.gametext: When in a battle, if both players draw only one battle destiny and yours is higher, reduces opponent's destiny to zero. Landspeed = 3. Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. May not be aboard starfighters or enclosed vehicles.
front.lore: A female Quor'sav, a warm-blooded, avian/monotreme species. 3.5 meters tall. Over-protective mother. Freelance pilot. Has custom-built ship with tall corridors. Lays eggs.

cancels: Kitik Keed'kak is lost if at same site as Kal'Falnl C'ndros

front.title: •Kalit
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. Your Jawa Siesta is not unique (•), is doubled, deploys free (or for 6 Force from each player) and cumulatively affects your Jawas' forfeit. While at Audience Chamber or Jawa Camp, all your other Jawas are power +2.
front.lore: Jawa leader. Seeking to peacefully settle a long standing disagreement with his rival, Wittin. Wants Jabba to mediate their talks.

pulledBy: Princess Organa to deploy to same location
combo: Kalit + Jawa Siesta

front.title: •Kalit's Sandcrawler
front.gametext: Deploys only on Tatooine. May add 1 driver and 7 passengers. While your Jawa is aboard, this vehicle and your Jawas at same site are immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 if Kalit at same site).
front.lore: Provides enclosed shelter from harsh Tatooine climate, Tusken Raiders and krayt dragons. Kalit offers sanctuary to others when traveling (even members of enemy Jawa tribes).

front.title: •Kamino
front.gametext: Light:  Once per turn, may use 1 Force to deploy a Kamino site from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  Dark:  If opponent has two clones on table, Force drain -1 here.

front.title: •Kamino: Clone Birthing Center
front.gametext: Light:  During your deploy phase, your clone here may move to a site you occupy for free.  Dark:  If you initiate battle here, add one battle destiny. Fetts may move to and from here for free.

front.title: •Kamino: Clone Training Center
front.gametext: Light:  While you control, your non-unique clone troopers are power and forfeit +1.  Dark:  Fetts deploy -1 here.

front.title: •Kanan Jarrus
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. While present with an Imperial (or two Rebels), all immunity to attrition here is canceled.
front.lore: Padawan.

front.title: •Karie Neth
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. While aboard your starship, adds 1 to each of its weapon destiny draws (2 if Gray Squadron 2 or when with Telsij).
front.lore: Gray Squadron 2's gunner at the Battle of Endor. Member of Rogue Squadron. Replaced Bothan pilot lost during secret mission ordered by Rebel command staff.

combo: endor

front.title: •Kashyyyk
front.gametext: Light:  Your Wookiees and smugglers deploy -2 here.  Dark:  Total ability of 6 or more required for you to draw battle destiny here.

front.title: Kashyyyk Operative
front.gametext: While at a Kashyyyk site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is forfeit +1 (and power +1 if your Wookiee is on Kashyyyk) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Kashyyyk from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Following the subjugation of Kashyyyk by the Empire, the Alliance hired merchants to 'purchase' Wookiee slaves to be freed.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Kazak
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. When present at an Endor site, adds 1 to your Force drains at each Endor site where another of your Ewoks is present.
front.lore: Elder Ewok advisor to Chief Chirpa. Studied Imperial patrols and helped plan attacks.

combo: Kazak + Graak
Kazak + Ewok Spear + Ewok Glider

front.title: Ke Chu Ke Kukuta?
front.gametext: If opponent just deployed an Imperial to a Jabba's Palace site (and you have no Rebels at any Jabba's Palace site), return Imperial to opponent's hand. Any Force used to deploy that Imperial remains used and Imperial may not be deployed for remainder of turn.
front.lore: 'Balka. Hachu ma blinki?'

front.title: •Kebyc
front.gametext: When at a site and opponent is losing Force from Force drains at cloud sectors on same planet, lost Force must come from Reserve Deck, if possible.
front.lore: Senior accountant for the Cloud City Miner's Guild. Administrates the annual dues and fights corruption among her fellow guild members.

front.title: Keep Your Eyes Open
front.gametext: If a battle was just initiated where you have two smugglers, you may move any or all of your characters, vehicles and starships away (at normal use of the Force). OR Glance at the cards in any Lost Pile and replace unshuffled.
front.lore: 'Look, don't worry. Everything's gonna be fine. Trust me.'

canceledBy: Point Man (V) (during a battle at a site)

front.title: Keep Your Eyes Open (V)
front.gametext: USED: Cancel an attempt to fire a weapon during any move phase.  LOST: If a battle was just initiated, lose 1 Force to prevent all weapons from being fired for remainder of battle.
front.lore: 'Look, don't worry. Everything's gonna be fine. Trust me.'

canceledBy: Point Man (V) (during a battle at a site)

front.title: •Keeping The Empire Out Forever
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If you control two Cloud City sites and occupy Bespin system, flip Quiet Mining Colony. While Independent Operation on table, it may not flip and once per turn may search your Force Pile and take one card there into hand; reshuffle. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: 'Our operation is small enough not to be noticed...'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Keir Santage
front.gametext: Adds 2 to the power of anything he pilots. When at a system, sector, or docking bay, once during each of your deploy phases, may subtract 2 from deploy cost of your unique (•) X-wing deploying here.
front.lore: Rescued from an Imperial detention center by Wedge Antilles. Rogue Squadron veteran. Assigned to Red Squadron at the Battle of Endor. Coordinates with Rebellion procurement.

front.title: •Kessel
front.gametext: Light:  If you control, Force drain +1 here.  Dark:  If you control, Kessel Run is prevented (canceled).

combo: Corellia + Kessel + Kessel Run Because of its low parsec number, Corellia makes an ideal planet to begin a Kessel Run from.  Raltiir + Raltiir Freighter Captain + Kessel + Kessel Run: Raltiir Freighter Captain doubles X on Kessel Run

front.title: •Kessel Run
front.gametext: Deploy on Kessel. Target one of your smugglers at another system. X=parsec distance between the two systems. When target reaches Kessel, opponent draws destiny. If = 0, starship lost. Otherwise, by returning to first system, 'retrieve' X Lost Force.
front.lore: Planet Kessel has infamous glitterstim spice mines attracting smugglers and pirates. A 'Kessel run' is a long, dangerous hyper-route they must travel quickly.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: Kessel Run + Ralltiir Freighter Captain + Ralltiir

front.title: •Ketwol
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Once per turn, may exchange a docking bay from hand with top card of Lost Pile. Your docking bay transit is free when moving to or from same site.
front.lore: Pacithhip scout. From an unknown system on the Outer Rim. Spends most of his time talking to pilots and travelers at local docking bays.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)

front.title: •Ki-Adi-Mundi
front.gametext: Deploys +3 if not to Jedi Council Chamber. While at a battleground site, if opponent just initiated a battle at same or adjacent site, opponent must lose top card of their Reserve Deck (if possible). Immune to attrition < 5 while at Jedi Council Chamber.
front.lore: Cerean Jedi trained by Yoda since the age of four. Only Jedi Council member who is a Jedi Knight. Freed his homeworld from a group of rogues without any bloodshed.

combo: Jedi Council Chamber + Yoda, Senior Council Member + Ki-Adi-Mundi
Ki-Adi-Mundi + Arconas
Ki-Adi-Mundi + Smoke Screen
Ki-Adi-Mundi + Are You Brain Dead?!

front.title: •Kiffex
front.gametext: Light:  If you occupy with exactly 2 starships, your total power here is +2 and Vul Tazaene anywhere is doubled.  Dark:  If you occupy with exactly 2 starships, your total power here is +2.

combo: Kiffex + Vul Tazaene

front.title: Kiffex Operative
front.gametext: While at a Kiffex site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is forfeit +1 (and power +1 if your spy or Vul Tazaene is on Kiffex) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Kiffex from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Some Snivvians on Kiffex maintain a covert presence and coordinate information to help plan attacks on Imperial convoys.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Kin Kian
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything he pilots. While aboard your starship, adds 2 to each of its weapon destiny draws. While aboard a unique (•) Gray Squadron Y-wing at a system or sector, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.
front.lore: Rogue Squadron pilot. Assigned as gunner aboard Colonel Salm's Y-wing at Battle of Endor, as part of Gray Squadron. Former member of Aggressor Squadron.

front.title: •Kin Kian (V)
front.gametext: Matching pilot for any snub fighter. While piloting a snub fighter, draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise and opponent may not substitute battle destiny draws here.
front.lore: Rogue Squadron pilot. Assigned as gunner aboard Colonel Salm's Y-wing at Battle of Endor, as part of Gray Squadron. Former member of Aggressor Squadron.

front.title: •Kirdo III
front.gametext: Light:  If you occupy, once per turn, may search Reserve Deck and take any Desert, Kitonak, or Sandwhirl into hand; reshuffle.  Dark:  If you control, Force drain -1 here.

front.title: Kirdo III Operative
front.gametext: While at a Kirdo III site: adds 1 to your Force drains there, is forfeit +1 (and power +1 if your Kitonak is on Kirdo III) and, once during each of your deploy phases, may deploy one site to Kirdo III from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Some traders who run convoys to Kirdo III relay secret information from the Rebel population of Kirdo III. These traders have extensive experience with the Kitonak.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •Kit Fisto
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Deploys -1 to an [Episode I] site (-2 if underwater). Landspeed = 2. Once per turn, may use 1 Force (or place your combat card here in Used Pile) to draw top card of Reserve Deck. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Nautolan Jedi Council member.

front.title: •••Kitonak
front.gametext: Power +1 at a Tatooine site, or power +2 at any desert. Immune to Gravel Storm, Sandwhirl and desert landspeed requirements. Immune to attrition < the number of your musicians present.
front.lore: Natives of Kirdo III, a desert world, Kitonak possess tough, leathery skin. Many become musicians. Very patient. Thousands have been enslaved by the Empire.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: Klatooinian Revolutionary
front.gametext: Power +2 at any Jabba's Palace site. May 'react' by deploying or moving to same site as any Hutt.
front.lore: Some Klatooinians escaped enslavement by Hutt organizations. Continually fighting to free their species. Hate all Hutts.

pulledBy: Nar Shaddaa Wind Chimes & Out Of Somewhere

front.title: •K'lor'slug
front.gametext: Deploy on your side of table. For each unit of ability you have present during a battle, you may use 1 Force to raise your total power by 1. Ability used in this way cannot also be used to draw destiny.
front.lore: Dejarik hologram of venomous swamp creature from Noe'ha'on. Keen senses of smell and vision. Dangerous hunter. Lays eggs - hundreds of ravenously hungry hatchlings.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
combo: K'lor'slug + BG-J38 Adds 2 to the destiny of each of your holograms and dejariks drawn for battle destiny or weapon destiny.

front.title: •K'lor'slug (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on table. If your character, starship, or vehicle in battle is about to be lost before the damage segment, it is instead lost at end of battle (if forfeited, forfeit for 0). (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Dejarik hologram of venomous swamp creature from Noe'ha'on. Keen senses of smell and vision. Dangerous hunter. Lays eggs - hundreds of ravenously hungry hatchlings.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Knights Of The Old Republic
front.gametext: USED: If present with a Dark Jedi or [Episode I] Jedi, your Padawan is power +2 for remainder of turn. OR Deploy one [Episode I] lightsaber from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.  LOST: Once per game, retrieve a Padawan or [Episode I] lightsaber.
front.lore: A Jedi seeks nonviolent solutions to problems, but may fight to preserve the existence of life. An apprentice must learn which battles to fight and which to avoid.

front.title: •Koensayr Manufacturing
front.gametext: Deploy on Ralltiir system. Once during each of your control phases, you may retrieve one Y-wing. Also Special Modifications is not unique (•) and makes its target immune to attrition < 4. Suspended while opponent controls Ralltiir. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Company responsible for design of the rugged Y-wing snub fighter. Maintains sales offices on many planets. Koensayr parts often find their way into a variety of ships.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Krayt Dragon Howl
front.gametext: If Obi-Wan is defending a battle alone at a site, add 1 to power and add one battle destiny. OR If any other Rebel with ability > 2 is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Using Jedi skill, Obi-Wan Kenobi imitated perfectly the mournful howl of the dangerous krayt dragon to scare Tusken Raiders away from Luke Skywalker.

combo: Krayt Dragon Howl + any Obi-Wan persona

front.title: •Lak Sivrak
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. May move as a 'react' for free. While at opponent's battleground, may not be targeted by opponent's Interrupts and your Force drains here may not be canceled or reduced by opponent.
front.lore: Lak Sivrak is a typical Shistavanen male. Ferocious, but not aggressive. Often trained as scouts at Imperial academies, but they despise the ambitions of the New Order.

front.title: ••Landing Claw
front.gametext: Deploy on one of your starfighters. During any control phase, may target one opponent's capital starship present. Starfighter attaches to target (automatically moves with target and is 'concealed'). May detach at any time (even as target begins to move).
front.lore: Special modification for starfighters. Size may vary depending on mass of starship. Allows a stable connection to a spacedock, uneven terrain or even another starship.

canceledBy: Ghhhk & Those Rebels Won't Escape Us

front.title: •Lando Calrissian
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots (3 if piloting Falcon). Power +1 for every Cloud City location you control. When playing Sabacc, may add 1 to or subtract 1 from your total.
front.lore: Gambler. Scoundrel. Former owner of the Millennium Falcon. Despite a notorious past, has become a successful chief administrator of a Tibanna gas mining facility.

front.title: •Lando Calrissian (V)
front.gametext: Smuggler. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When deployed, may take a character with 'Cloud City' in lore into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. During battle, may use 1 Force to cancel the game text of a Dark Jedi (except Vader) at same site.
front.lore: Gambler. Scoundrel. Former owner of the Millennium Falcon. Despite a notorious past, has become a successful chief administrator of a Tibanna gas mining facility.

cancels: Game text of a Dark Jedi (except Vader) at same site for 1 Force

front.title: •Lando Calrissian, Scoundrel
front.gametext: Adds one battle destiny. If opponent initiates battle at same location, retrieve 1 Force and add its destiny number to Lando's power, or power of Falcon he is piloting. End of your turn: Use 1 Force to maintain OR Lose 2 Force to place in Used Pile OR Place out of play.
front.lore: With a silvery tongue or a rapid-fire blaster, Lando prides himself on being able to get out of tight situations. Is at his best when cornered.

front.title: •Lando In Millennium Falcon
front.gametext: May add 1 pilot and 2 passengers. Permanent pilot is •Lando, who provides ability of 3 and adds 3 to power. May not be piloted by Han unless he won a hand of sabacc this game. Immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Heavily modified Corellian YT-1300 freighter. 'She's the fastest hunk of junk in the galaxy.'

front.title: •Lando With Blaster Pistol
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Adds one battle destiny if with your other alien on Cloud City. Permanent weapon is blaster pistol (may target a character for free; draw destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Smuggler, gambler and leader. 'Yeah, I'm responsible these days. It's the price you pay for being successful.'

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
combo: Lando With Blaster Pistol + Blaster Proficiency Add 3 to your weapon destiny.

front.title: •Lando With Vibro-Ax
front.gametext: Deploys -2 on Tatooine. When at a Tatooine site, adds one battle destiny. Permanent weapon is vibro-ax (may target character for free; both players draw destiny; target excluded from battle if your destiny +4 > target's power + opponent's destiny).
front.lore: Gambler. Spy in Jabba's Court. Has walked the palace's passageways and overheard many details of Jabba's operations on Tatooine.

pulledBy: Soth Petikkin (when at a Jabba's Palace site you control)
combo: Lando With Vibro-Ax + Double Agent

front.title: •Lando's Blaster Rifle
front.gametext: Deploy on your Lando or use 3 Force to deploy on your other warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. If Lando targeting a character, target is power -2 for remainder of turn. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value.
front.lore: Standard-issue Imperial blaster rifle appropriated by Lando from a stormtrooper. Used by Calrissian to pin down stormtroopers as he made his escape from Cloud City.

front.title: •Lando's Not A System, He's A Man
front.gametext: Deploy on table. Once per turn, may target a character present with [Cloud City] Lando. For remainder of turn, target is forfeit = 0. During battle on Cloud City, you may use X Force (maximum 3) to add X to your total battle destiny. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Lando Calrissian has quite a reputation amongst gamblers and smugglers. This is not always a good thing.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Lando's Wrist Comlink
front.gametext: Deploy on a character. When at a Cloud City site, Lobot and your Cloud City troopers may deploy or move here as a 'react.'
front.lore: Easily concealed device used by Lando to remain in contact with his subordinates. Directly connected to Cloud City's central computer.

front.title: •Laudica
front.gametext: When in a battle, you may 'react' by deploying any one non-unique blaster (for free) on Laudica from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. When present with your non-unique Corellian at a site, allows your character weapons to transfer for free there.
front.lore: Corellian gun-runner. Skilled markswoman. Friends with Brindy Truchong and the Tonnika sisters. Romantically involved with Rayc Ryjerd, against her better judgment.

front.title: •Launching The Assault
front.gametext: Deploy on any system. Once per game, may take Home One into from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Your Force drains are +1 at battleground systems where you have a Star Cruiser piloted by a character. Effecte canceled when Rendezvous Point on table. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: By recruiting the Mon Calamari, a race of master shipwrights, the Rebel starfleet gained capital starships rivaling the dreaded Imperial Star Destroyers.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •LE-BO2D9 (Leebo)
front.gametext: May be battled. While aboard any freighter adds 2 to hyperspeed and may draw one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. If you have completed Rycar's Run or Kessel Run, opponent loses 1 Force (2 if both) during each of your control phases.
front.lore: Smuggler. Heavily modified Cybot Galactica LE-series repair droid. Information broker. Provides information gained through underworld channels to the Alliance.

front.title: •Leesub Sirln
front.gametext: Once each turn during your control phase, may use 1 Force to guess a card type and point to a card in opponent's hand. Card must be shown. If guessed correctly, card is lost.
front.lore: Leesub is a Qiraash (near-human). Enslaved as child. Limited precognition. Selected by Imperial High Inquisitor Tremayne as Force adept. Escaped and hiding in Mos Eisley.

front.title: •Leesub Sirln (V)
front.gametext: Once during your control phase, may use 1 Force to name a card type. Reveal top card of opponent's Reserve Deck. If that card matches the named card type, it is lost. Otherwise, replace it or move it to opponent's Used Pile. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Leesub is a Qiraash (near-human). Enslaved as child. Limited precognition. Selected by Imperial High Inquisitor Tremayne as Force adept. Escaped and hiding in Mos Eisley.

combo: Leesub Sirlin (V) + Depa Billaba (@ JCC) + Critical Error Revealed + BG-J38

front.title: •Legendary Starfighter
front.gametext: If opponent just lost a starship in a battle you won, deploy on your participating starfighter. Once during each of opponent's move phases, opponent loses 1 Force (2 if starfighter is Falcon or Red 5). Also, that starfighter is power +2 (Immune to Control.)
front.lore: The Millennium Falcon's well-known reputation is favorable not only for its captain and first mate, but for the Alliance as well.

pulledBy: Don't Do That Again - Defensive Shield
Don't Do That Again (V) - Defensive Shield
We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Leia
front.gametext: <none>
front.lore: Adopted daughter of the Viceroy and First Chairman of Alderaan. Became a political leader at a young age. The injustices of the New Order led her to join the Rebellion.

combo: Leia + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.

front.title: •Leia (V)
front.gametext: While at opponent's Galactic Senate, Leia's game text may not be canceled and may lose 1 Force to place Leia and any character present out of play. During battle, may cancel game text of a leader of ability < 5 with Leia for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Adopted daughter of the Viceroy and First Chairman of Alderaan. Became a political leader at a young age. The injustices of the New Order led her to join the Rebellion.

combo: Leia (V) + Jerus Jannick
Leia (V) + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.
cancels: Game text of leader of ability < 5 (during battle)

front.title: •Leia Of Alderaan
front.gametext: Deploy on Leia. While at any Rebel Base site, your Rebels, except unique (•) Rebels, are deploy -2 and power +2 at same and adjacent sites. While at any system, your starfighters, except unique (•) starfighters, are deploy -2 there.
front.lore: The face that launched a thousand starships.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Leia Of Alderaan (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on Leia (or your female of ability < 4). Opponent may not cancel or reduce Force drains at same battleground. If on Leia, she is power +2 and, once per battle, may cancel the game text of an opponent's leader of ability < 4 here.
front.lore: The face that launched a thousand starships.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Leia Organa
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of each Rebel present with her at a Death Star site. 'Diplomatic' immunity to attrition < 2.
front.lore: Strong-willed princess from Alderaan. Youngest Imperial Senator ever. Used diplomatic immunity to spy for Rebels. Led relief effort on Ralltir. Natural leader.

combo: Leia Organa +
Leia Organa + Jerus Jannick
Leia Organa + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.
Leia Organa + Double Agent

front.title: •Leia Organa (V)
front.gametext: Agenda: rebellion. May not be 'choked.' Gains [Republic] at Galactic Senate. Draws one battle destiny if unable to otherwise (if with an Imperial leader, may add one destiny to total power or attrition instead). 'Diplomatic' immunity to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Strong-willed princess from Alderaan. Youngest Imperial Senator ever. Used diplomatic immunity to spy for Rebels. Led relief effort on Ralltir. Natural leader.

rulings: If she adds a destiny to total power or attrition, she can no longer draw one battle destiny if unable to otherwise that battle.

front.title: •Leia With Blaster Rifle
front.gametext: Adds 1 to power of anything she pilots. Adds one battle destiny if with Han. Permanent weapon is •Leia's Blaster Rifle (may target a character or creature for free; draw destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +1 > defense value).
front.lore: Spirited leader. 'I am not a committee!'

combo: Leia With Blaster Rifle +
Leia With Blaster Rifle + Jerus Jannick
Leia With Blaster Rifle + Blaster Proficiency Add 3 to your weapon destiny.
Leia With Blaster Rifle + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.

front.title: •Leia, Rebel Princess
front.gametext: Twice per game, may place top card of Lost Pile on top of Reserve Deck to cancel a Force drain at a related site. Unless opponent's non-alien character here, opponent's total ability at same site = 0. Immune to attrition < 5 if with Luke, Han or Jabba.
front.lore: After attracting Luke's attention and then Han's attention, Leia should not have been surprised when she got more attention than desired from Jabba.

combo: Leia, Rebel Princess+
Leia, Rebel Princess + Jerus Jannick
Leia, Rebel Princess + Warrior's Courage Add two battle destinies if Leia is defending a battle alone at a site.
cancels: A Force drain at a related site (twice per game)
rulings: Mara Jade is an alien (not a non-alien).

If a non-alien is excluded and this causes Leia's text to make Light control the site, the excluded character is still active for the purposes of Objective flip conditions (e.g. Imperial Entanglements) and for the purposes of preventing cards like Search And Destroy from leaving table.

front.title: Leia's Back
front.gametext: If Leia is lost, use 1 Force to retrieve her from the Lost Pile. OR Use 3 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take Leia into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.
front.lore: 'It's not over yet!'

front.title: •Leia's Blaster Rifle
front.gametext: Deploy on your Leia or use 3 Force to deploy on your other warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny +1 > defense value. If hit by Leia, target is lost.
front.lore: Standard production blaster rifle issued at Echo Base. Modified by Rebel engineers for Leia's use. Has less recoil and a higher recharge rate.

front.title: •Leia's Sporting Blaster
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on Leia, or 2 on your warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle for free. Draw destiny. Target hit if destiny -1 > defense value. If hit by Leia, target's forfeit = 0.
front.lore: Defender sporting blaster, made by Drearian Defense Conglomerate. Intended for personal defense or small-game hunting. Short range. Low power. Carries energy for 50 shots.

front.title: •Leslomy Tacema
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything she pilots. While at Audience Chamber, adds 2 to the power bonus provided by Ellorrs Madak.
front.lore: Female Duros. Expert pilot. Helps run the docking facilities in Mos Eisley. Friends with Ellorrs Madak. Approves all cargo manifests. Forgiving of minor transgressions.

front.title: •Leslomy Tacema (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything she pilots. Smuggler. Adds 1 to hyperspeed of any freighter she pilots. Your total ability at same docking bay or system may not be reduced. Once per game, may deploy a card with 'Ellorrs' in title here from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Female Duros. Expert pilot. Helps run the docking facilities in Mos Eisley. Friends with Ellorrs Madak. Approves all cargo manifests. Forgiving of minor transgressions.

front.title: •Let The Wookiee Win
front.gametext: During a battle at a holosite, add one battle destiny. OR Target an opponent's character of ability < 5 present with your Wookiee that just participated in a battle you lost; character is Disarmed (power -1 and may no longer carry weapons). Stack on that character.
front.lore: 'It's not wise to upset a Wookiee.' 'But sir, nobody worries about upsetting a droid.' 'That's cause a droid don't pull people's arms out of their sockets when they lose.'

front.title: •Let's Go Left
front.gametext: Non-pilot characters aboard starships are forfeit -4. Whenever a player's starship is 'hit', that player loses 1 Force (2 if starship was hit by Proton Torpedoes). At systems where you have only [Republic] starships, all of those starships are immune to attrition < 4. At sites related to a system you occupy, your battle destinies may not be canceled by opponent.

cards.counterpart: Nothing Can Get Through Our Shield

front.title: •Let's Keep A Little Optimism Here
front.gametext: Deploy on table. While you occupy a Renegade planet location, operatives are forfeit = 0, operatives do not add to Force drains and your Force drains may not be reduced. At any time, you may place Effect out of play to retrieve 1 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The heroes of the Rebellion know that where there is life, there is hope.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once
Your Insight Serves You Well & Staging Areas

front.title: •Let's Keep A Little Optimism Here
front.gametext: Plays on table. While you occupy a Renegade planet location, operatives are forfeit = 0, operatives do not add to Force drains and your Force drains may not be reduced. (Renegade planet is defined on the Objective card Imperial Occupation.)
front.lore: The heroes of the Rebellion know that where there is life, there is hope.

cards.counterpart: Leave Them To Me - Defensive Shield

front.title: Levitation
front.gametext: USED: Cancel Silence Is Golden or Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down.  LOST: Search your Used Pile and take any one droid, device or Stone Pile you find there into hand. Shuffle, cut and replace.
front.lore: Telekinesis is one of the powers awakened during a Jedi's apprenticeship. Using this ability, a student of the Force can learn to levitate objects.

cancels: Shut Him Up Or Shut Him Down

front.title: •Liana Merian
front.gametext: Agendas: peace, trade. While in a senate majority, once during opponent's turn, target an opponent's just drawn battle destiny; opponent must use or lose 2 Force or that battle destiny = 0.
front.lore: Alderaanian senator. Known for her efforts to promote peace throughout the Republic by using her homeworld as an example.

front.title: •Libertine
front.gametext: May add 2 pilots and 2 passengers. During your deploy phase, may relocate your character of ability < 4 aboard from a related exterior site. While BB-8, DJ, or Rose aboard, immune to attrition < 5.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Liberty
front.gametext: May add 5 pilots, 6 passengers, 1 vehicle, and 3 starfighters. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. May go to Used Pile instead of Lost Pile when forfeited (unless 'hit').
front.lore: Winged star cruiser. Military transport for technical units. Afforced special care by the Alliance's top engineers.

front.title: •Lieutenant Arven Wendik
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Bravo 3 at same system as a battleship, adds one destiny to attrition only.
front.lore: Bravo Squadron pilot who assisted in the attack at the battle of Naboo. Tactical expert of capital starship shield capabilities.

front.title: •Lieutenant Blount
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Tala 2, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise. While he occupies any Coruscant location, Empire's Sinister Agents is flipped and ISB Operations may not be flipped.
front.lore: Wingman of Colonel Cracken. Spy and scout. Former agent of the Imperial Security Bureau. Defected and joined Rebel Intelligence. Seasoned combat veteran.

combo: Lieutnant Blount + Double Agent

front.title: •Lieutenant Chamberlyn
front.gametext: Deploys -1 to Naboo. Once per game may deploy a blaster on Chamberlyn from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. Once during your control phase, may target a battle droid present and draw destiny. If destiny > 3, target lost.
front.lore: Royal Naboo security officer who became a leader of the underground movement against the Trade Federation. Known for discovering and analyzing battle droid weaknesses.

front.title: •Lieutenant Greeve
front.gametext: Adds 1 to each of his character weapon destiny draws (characters he 'hits' are forfeit -3). When firing an A280 Sharpshooter Rifle, may fire repeatedly at same target for 2 Force each time.
front.lore: Scout. Famous guide who was recruited for Madine's commando unit from the forests of Kashyyyk. Sharpshooter who uses one of the BlasTech rifles brought by Corporal Janse.

combo: Greeve + A280 Sharpshooter Rifle + Slight Weapons Malfunction Greeve can react to a battle, can fire repeatedly at +1 to hit, makes the target forfeit -3, and adds a battle destiny with Used interrupts!

Greeve + A280 Sharpshooter Rifle + Endor: Hidden Forest Trail Try and use the Hidden Trail to get Greeve next to a potential battle location, especially useful if you can set up a no Dark Side force icons location there (so they don't deploy to battle Greeve instead!). Try using a Nudj!

front.title: •Lieutenant Kaydel Connix
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything she pilots. Your shuttling, landing, and taking off to or from here is free. Once per game, may use 1 Force to take Evacuation Control, a [Resistance] bomber, or a [Resistance] transport into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Female.

front.title: •Lieutenant Lepira
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Gold 4 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Anoat system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.
front.lore: Piloted Gold 4 at the Battle of Yavin. Learned to fly a starfighter by racing through the Anoat system.

front.title: •Lieutenant Naytaan
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 9 during battle, adds one destiny to total power only. When at Clak'dor VII system, adds 1 to each of your Force drains there.
front.lore: Piloted Red 9 at the Battle of Yavin. Led the relief effort of Clak'dor VII in the Mayagil sector. Became an 'ace' in only two missions.

front.title: •Lieutenant Page
front.gametext: Adds 1 to each of your battle destiny draws when with Derlin, Cracken or Madine at a site (or when with at least two of your other scouts at an exterior planet site). Your Rebel scouts deploy -1 to same exterior site (except Rebel Landing Site).
front.lore: Scout who served under General Veers' command. Defected and was recruited by General Madine's commando organization. Works closely with Colonel Cracken.

front.title: •Lieutenant Rya Kirsch
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While aboard Bravo 4, draws one battle destiny if not able to otherwise, and opponent's droid starfighters are deploy +2 at same system.
front.lore: Became a member of Bravo Flight after embarrassing himself in front of Amidala as a guard. Has redeemed himself by becoming an expert in defense aviation tactics.

front.title: •Lieutenant s'Too Vees
front.gametext: When in battle at a site with Lando or Marmor, adds one destiny to total power only. When he is at a docking bay, once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one starship weapon from Reserve Deck on your starfighter present; reshuffle.
front.lore: Dock mechanic. Installs starfighters cannons. Gambler. Followed Lando from Cloud City. Turned down assignment in rear guard to work on General Calrissian's starship.

pulls: One starship weapon on your starfighter present (when at a docking bay)

front.title: •Lieutenant Tarn Mison
front.gametext: Deploys -1 aboard your unique (•) Rebel starfighter. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When starfighter he pilots fires a starship weapon, characters aboard target are forfeit = 0 for remainder of turn.
front.lore: Former Imperial pilot. Joined the Alliance shortly after the Battle of Yavin. Flew cover for Bright Hope during the evacuation of Hoth. Expert marksman.

front.title: •Lieutenant Telsij
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. When at a system, sector or docking bay, once during each of your deploy phases, may subtract 2 from deploy cost of your unique (•) Y-wing deploying there.
front.lore: One of only four attackers who survived the raid on the Imperial Academy at Carida. Gray Squadron pilot.

front.title: •Lieutenant Williams
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. While piloting Radiant VII and you have no other starships at same system, unless opponent has total ability > 6 piloting here, opponent's total battle destiny here is -3.
front.lore: Pilot of the Radiant VII. Was personally requested by Captain Madakor to assist in the transportation of the Jedi ambassadors.

combo: Lieutenant Williams + Captain Madakor + Radiant VII

front.title: •Life Debt
front.gametext: If Han and Chewie are in a battle together, add two battle destiny. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take Falcon into hand, and reshuffle. OR If Han is defending a battle alone, you may 'react' by deploying Chewie there (for free) from your Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: 'I'm all right, pal. I'm all right.'

combo: Life Debt + That's One That's One makes Life Debt a Used Interrupt.

front.title: Lift Tube
front.gametext: May carry 4 passengers. Deploy and move only at interior mobile sites. May move without presence aboard. Also, may move as a 'react' only to a battle or Force drain (if within range).
front.lore: System of enclosed high-speed vertical and horizontal transport cylinders. Used in space stations, large starships, Death Stars, etc.

combo: Lift Tube + Lift Tube Escape + Dune Sea Sabacc Lift Tube and Lift Tube Escape can be tracked pretty easily for perfect Sabacc. (Indiana Jones Jedi Knight)

front.title: •Lift Tube Escape
front.gametext: If opponent just initiated a battle, one of your Lift Tubes present may move as a 'react' from that battle. OR Place one of your unoccupied Lift Tubes on table in your Used Pile. OR Search your Reserve Deck, take one Lift Tube into hand and reshuffle.
front.lore: First floor: parasols and powdered blue milk. Second floor: bantha skin rugs, bog-wing drapes and juri juice tables. Third floor: a squadron of Imperial stormtroopers.

combo: Lift Tube Escape + Lift Tube + Dune Sea Sabacc Lift Tube and Lift Tube Escape can be tracked pretty easily for perfect Sabacc. (Indiana Jones Jedi Knight)

front.title: Light Maneuvers
front.gametext: Cancel Dark Maneuvers, Emergency Deployment, Lone Pilot, I Want That Ship, Defensive Fire, Rogue Asteroid or Take Evasive Action. OR Double Special Modifications until end of turn.
front.lore: Rookie TIE pilots often fail to grasp the gravity of their situation and are easily lured into compromising positions.

front.title: •Lightmaker
front.gametext: Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. Cancels opponent's immunity to attrition here. While at Scarif, adds 2 to attempts to 'blow away' Shield Gate.
front.lore: Phoenix Squadron.

front.title: •Lightsaber Proficiency
front.gametext: Deploy on your character with ability > 2 and a lightsaber. That character is power +3 in battles or may add 1 to Force drain where present. Effect is lost if character loses lightsaber.
front.lore: A Jedi learns not only to wield a lightsaber, but how to channel the Force to increase skill and control the lightsaber's damage.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Like My Father Before Me
front.gametext: If an Endor site on table, deploy on table. [Death Star II] Luke is deploy = 6 and may not be Disarmed. If Luke is at a battleground (even as a captive), your battle destiny draws are +1 there and, once during your turn, may deploy Luke's Lightsaber from Reserve Deck (reshuffle) or place a card from hand on Force Pile. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: The final act of Luke's ascension to Jedi Knighthood was sending off his father, draped in the garb of Vader.

combo: Like My Father Before Me + Luke Skywalker, Jedi Knight

front.title: LIN-V8K (Elleyein-Veeatekay)
front.gametext: At any time during your turn, may use 1 Force to 'defuse' (lose) any one mine at same site.
front.lore: Armored military droid which specializes in laying explosive mines. Originally intended to set charges inside ore and spice mines, but has also been converted for military use.

combo: LIN-V8K (Elleyein-Veeatekay) + Infantry Mine

front.title: •Lobot
front.gametext: Deploys only as a 'react' to a Cloud City site or to where your Lando is present. When present at a Scomp link, power +2 and opponent's total power is -2 at same site. Your Cloud City Troopers deploy free and are power +1 at same Cloud City site.
front.lore: Former criminal. Fitted with a cybernetic device. Now repays his debt to society by ensuring the smooth running of Cloud City. Becomes disoriented when not with a computer.

combo: Lobot + It's A Trap + Lots of Cloud City Troopers + any Cloud City site
Lobot + Lando + It's A Trap + Cyborg Construct

front.title: •Lobot (V)
front.gametext: Deploys free to Cloud City or a site with a scomp link. If a battle was just initiated at same site, may deploy an alien here (free if Lando) as 'react' from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. May deploy Cyborg Construct on Lobot from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Former criminal. Fitted with a cybernetic device. Now repays his debt to society by ensuring the smooth running of Cloud City. Becomes disoriented when not with a computer.

front.title: •Local Defense
front.gametext: Take one cloud car or [Independent] starship into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. OR If opponent just initiated a battle at a sector where none of your ability comes from Rebels or Rebel starships, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: Even seasoned smugglers respect a well-planned, well-armed defense.

front.title: Local Uprising / Liberation
front.gametext: Local Uprising:Deploy any planet system and one <> site to that system. This system is the Subjugated planet.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one <> site to the Subjugated planet from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if your matching operatives control at least three battleground sites related to the Subjugated planet.Liberation:{While} this side up, opponent's Force drains are -1. You may retrieve 1 Force whenever you deploy a matching operative to the Subjugated planet. Your matching operatives on that planet are each forfeit +2 and, when at the same site as an Imperial or AT-AT, are each power +2. When you have at least one matching operative in a battle on the Subjugated planet, you may add one battle destiny.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy at least two battleground sites related to the Subjugated planet.

back.title: Local Uprising / Liberation
back.gametext: Local Uprising:Deploy any planet system and one <> site to that system. This system is the Subjugated planet.{While} this side up, once during each of your deploy phases, you may deploy one <> site to the Subjugated planet from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.{Flip} this card if your matching operatives control at least three battleground sites related to the Subjugated planet.Liberation:{While} this side up, opponent's Force drains are -1. You may retrieve 1 Force whenever you deploy a matching operative to the Subjugated planet. Your matching operatives on that planet are each forfeit +2 and, when at the same site as an Imperial or AT-AT, are each power +2. When you have at least one matching operative in a battle on the Subjugated planet, you may add one battle destiny.{Flip} this card if you do not occupy at least two battleground sites related to the Subjugated planet.

rulings: The <> site deployed at start of game must be capable of deploying to that system.
If a <> site says it may not deploy to a Subjugated planet, it may not be deployed by this Objective at start of game.

front.title: •Loci Rosen
front.gametext: Power +X in a battle at a site, where X equals the number of cards in opponent's hand. During your deploy phase, opponent may place any number of cards in their hand in their Used Pile.
front.lore: Good-willed Mon Calamari merchant. Looking for work. Unfortunately, everywhere he goes he comes up empty handed.

front.title: •Logistical Delay
front.gametext: Use 3 Force to deploy on opponent's side of table. All opponent's TIEs are deploy +1.
front.lore: The Empire's tremendous military machine requires extensive coordination at every level. Slight errors in any step can quickly escalate supply delays.

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Logray
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. When on Endor, adds 1 to total battle destiny wherever you have any Ewok at an Endor site.
front.lore: Ewok tribal shaman and medicine man. Musician. Wears the skull of a great Churi bird. Suspicious of outsiders. Revered for his wisdom.

front.title: •Loje Nella
front.gametext: While at Audience Chamber, suspends Gailid's and Mosep's game text and allows you to activate 1 Force whenever you Force drain with an alien.
front.lore: Accountant. Descended from a species of cliff boring worms. Reluctant assistant to Mosep. Purposefully mismanages funds to obstruct Jabba's nefarious activities.

combo: Loje Nella + Arcona

front.title: Lone Rogue
front.gametext: If one of your pilots is at an exterior Hoth site, use 2 Force to search your Reserve Deck and take one T-47 into hand. OR If your piloted T-47 is defending a battle alone at a site, add one battle destiny.
front.lore: The pilots at the Rebel Base on Hoth are trained to respond quickly to the Empire's forces. Many Rebels feel that they could take on the whole Empire themselves.

front.title: •Lor San Tekka
front.gametext: If you just deployed BB-8 or a Resistance leader to same or related location, may draw top card of Reserve Deck. During your control phase, one of your other Resistance characters present may make a regular move.
front.lore: Information broker. Leader.

pulledBy: Why Does Everyone Want To Go Back To Jakku?!

front.title: •Losing Track
front.gametext: USED: During battle, place top card of opponent's Lost Pile on top of their Reserve Deck.  LOST: Use 1 Force to 'repair' your Podracer. OR Target a Podracer. Draw destiny. If destiny > Podracer's destiny number, target is 'damaged.'
front.lore: 'Wha-? Chuba da noya!'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Lost In The Wilderness
front.gametext: Cancel a Force drain at an exterior planet site where opponent has no vehicles or starships. Draw destiny. If destiny > number of opponent's characters at that site, choose one of those characters to be missing.
front.lore: Survival training becomes essential when an Imperial Scout trooper is separated from his speeder bike.

cancels: A Force drain at an exterior planet site where opponent has no starships or vehicles

front.title: Lost Relay
front.gametext: Target one opponent's starfighter present with one of your starships at an asteroid sector, before asteroid destiny is drawn this turn. If target lost this turn due to asteroid destiny, opponent also loses Force equal to target's forfeit value.
front.lore: Asteroid fields require starfighters to act as comm relays, forwarding orders to the squadron via subspace AE-35 Transceivers. If ships are lost, communications break down.

front.title: Lucky Shot
front.gametext: Add X to one weapon destiny (before weapon destiny is drawn) when targeting a combat vehicle. USED: X = 1.  LOST: X = 3.
front.lore: AT-ATs are nearly impervious to infantry fire, but occasionally a blaster bolt hits between the plating. It's one shot in a million, but such odds are a familiar to the Rebellion.

rulings: Works with Vehicle Mine.

front.title: •Luke
front.gametext: Must deploy on Tatooine, but may move elsewhere. May not be deployed if two or more of opponent's unique (•) characters on table. Your warriors at same site as Luke, or adjacent sites are forfeit +1.
front.lore: Raised by guardians Owen and Beru Lars on a moisture farm on Tatooine, where Owen wanted him to stay. Nicknamed 'Wormie' by childhood friends Camie and Fixer.

front.title: •Luke Skywalker
front.gametext: While Luke is not on Tatooine your total Force generation is +1. Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. When piloting Red 5, also adds 2 to maneuver. Immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: Son of Anakin Skywalker. Student of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Honed piloting skills while bullseyeing womp rats in Beggar's Canyon aboard T-16 skyhopper.

front.title: •Luke Skywalker (V)
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. If piloting lead starfighter, Attack Run total is +3. During your control phase, if piloting at a battleground, may take Darklighter Spin into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle or retrieve 1 Force.
front.lore: Son of Anakin Skywalker. Student of Obi-Wan Kenobi. Honed piloting skills while bullseyeing womp rats in Beggar's Canyon aboard T-16 skyhopper.

pulls: All Wings Report In & Darklighter Spin

front.title: •Luke Skywalker, Jedi Knight
front.gametext: Deploys -3 to Home One or Endor. Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Power +2 when armed with a lightsaber. Subtracts 3 from any attempt to cross him over (even if captured). Immune to attrition < 5 (< 6 if alone or armed with a lightsaber, < 7 if both).
front.lore: Scout trained in the ways of the Force. Key figure for both the Alliance and the Empire. Desired by Vader as an ally, by Palpatine as a servant and by the Alliance as its savior.

combo: Like My Father Before Me + Luke Skywalker, Jedi Knight

front.title: •Luke Skywalker, Rebel Scout
front.gametext: May cancel immunity to attrition of any vehicle here. If escorted by Vader and Take Your Father's Place on table, during your move phase may relocate Vader (with Luke) to Death Star II: Throne Room. Immune to Always Thinking With Your Stomach and Attrition < 5.
front.lore: Resourceful scout and member of the Rebel infiltration team assembled to destroy the shield generator. Surrendered to his father so that he would not endanger the mission.

cancels: Immunity to attrition of any vehicle at same site

front.title: •Luke Skywalker, Rebel Scout (V)
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. If drawn for destiny, may take into hand to cancel and redraw that destiny. Power +1 for each Dark Jedi here. Luke's weapon destiny draws are +1. At same site, opponent must first use 1 Force to fire a weapon. Immune to attrition < 6.
front.lore: Resourceful scout and member of the Rebel infiltration team assembled to destroy the shield generator. Surrendered to his father so that he would not endanger the mission.

front.title: •Luke Skywalker, The Last Jedi
front.gametext: Never deploys to a site opponent occupies. Deploys -2 to Ahch-To. Once per turn, may take Force Projection into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle. During battle, may cancel an opponent's just drawn destiny to cause a re-draw. Immune to attrition.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Luke Skywalker, The Rebellion's Hope
front.gametext: Adds 3 to power of anything he pilots. If armed with a blaster or rifle at a site (or piloting Red 5), may add one destiny to total power or attrition. Run Luke, Run! is a Used Interrupt. Immune to attrition < 4.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Luke With Lightsaber
front.gametext: Adds 2 to power of anything he pilots. Permanent weapon is •Luke's Lightsaber (may target a character or creature for free; draw two destiny; target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value).
front.lore: 'I've taken care of everything.'

combo: Luke With Lightsaber + A Jedi's Resilience

front.title: Luke's Back
front.gametext: If Luke is lost, use 1 Force to retrieve him from the Lost Pile. OR Use 3 Force to search through your Reserve Deck and take Luke into your hand. Shuffle deck, cut and replace.
front.lore: 'It looks like I'm going nowhere.'

front.title: •Luke's Backpack
front.gametext: Deploy on any character. May carry and use any number of devices. May also carry Yoda, Kabe or any one Jawa or Ewok (as if riding a creature vehicle). Adds 1 to training destiny when carrying the Mentor.
front.lore: Made on Dantooine. Luke used the many pockets in his gundark-skin backpack to carry supplies while on patrol.

rulings: Does not allow the character to use devices that they cannot use otherwise.

front.title: •Luke's Bionic Hand
front.gametext: Deploy on Luke. Luke's power and immunity to attrition are +2. During battle at a battleground, may exchange a card in hand with an Interrupt in Lost Pile. This device lost if Luke Disarmed.
front.lore: Uses state-of-the-art digital processors. Although Luke had lost his hand, the Alliance could rebuild it. They had the technology. They could make it better, stronger, faster.

pulls: Any Interrupt from Lost Pile (exchange with card from hand)

front.title: •Luke's Blaster Pistol
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on Luke, 3 on your other warrior. May target a character, creature or vehicle using 2 Force (if targeted by Luke, target loses immunity to attrition for remainder of turn.) Draw destiny. Add 1 if targeting a character or creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Merr-Sonn Model 57. Part of an arms lot purchased for the Alliance from a black market dealer on Ord Mantell. Carried by Luke as a backup for his father's lightsaber.

front.title: •Luke's Blaster Pistol (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on non-Jedi Luke. May target a character for free. Target loses any immunity to attrition for remainder of turn. Draw destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if destiny +2 > defense value. If about to be lost, may lose 1 Force to place on bottom of Used Pile.
front.lore: Merr-Sonn Model 57. Part of an arms lot purchased for the Alliance from a black market dealer on Ord Mantell. Carried by Luke as a backup for his father's lightsaber.

front.title: •Luke's Cape
front.gametext: Use 2 Force to deploy on a Rebel or alien. If Luke's Cape is not at a Tatooine location, your total Force generation is +1. That character is immune to attrition < 3.
front.lore: A symbol of the adventurous pilot and the awakening of his destiny. 'You've taken your first step into a larger world.'

pulledBy: We Wish To Board At Once

front.title: •Luke's Hunting Rifle
front.gametext: Use 1 Force to deploy on Luke or Owen Lars, 3 on your non-droid character. May target a character or creature using 1 Force. Draw destiny. Subtract 1 if targeting a character. Add 2 if targeting a creature. Target hit if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Czerka 6-2Aug2. Extended barrel provides long-range targeting without expensive laser sight. Sturdy construction, but no match for a Tusken Raider's gaderffi stick.

front.title: •Luke's Hunting Rifle (V)
front.gametext: Deploy on your alien or Rebel. May target a character or creature for free. Draw destiny. Target hit, if destiny +2 > defense value. If hit by Luke or Owen, target's forfeit = 0 and you retrieve 1 Force. Once during your move phase, may fire at a Jawa or Undercover spy.
front.lore: Czerka 6-2Aug2. Extended barrel provides long-range targeting without expensive laser sight. Sturdy construction, but no match for a Tusken Raider's gaderffi stick.

front.title: •Luke's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Luke. Adds 1 to defense value and training destiny. May add 1 to Force drain where present. May target a character, creature, speeder bike, or swoop for free. Draw 2 destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0 if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Weapon of a truly powerful warrior. Constructed by Luke as part of his training.

front.title: •Luke's T-16 Skyhopper
front.gametext: Requires 1 pilot to use. May carry 1 passenger. May move as a 'react.' may 'bullseye' one Womp Rat per turn. *Landspeed = 4, OR 1 character may shuttle to or from same site for free.
front.lore: Enclosed vehicle used by Luke Skywalker for his early pilot training. Often raced with Biggs Darklighter through Beggar's Canyon.

front.title: •Luke's X-34 Landspeeder
front.gametext: May add 1 driver and 2 passengers. Moves free if Luke aboard. May move as a 'react.'
front.lore: Skywalker's SoroSuub. Common open (AI)r transport. Top speed 250 km per hour. Repulsorlift drive keeps it suspended one meter above ground, even when parked.

front.title: •Lumat
front.gametext: Deploys only on Endor. Power and forfeit +1 for each Light side icon at same Endor site. When on Endor, adds 1 to total weapon destiny whenever you have any Ewok using an Ewok weapon at an Endor site.
front.lore: Ewok archer. Wood carver. Tribal elder that advises Chief Chirpa. Crafts and maintains weapons.

front.title: •Luminous
front.gametext: Deploys and moves like a starfighter. May add 1 pilot and 6 passengers. Has ship-docking capability. Permanent pilot provides ability of 2. May use Covert Landing like a shuttle or starfighter (even while landed).
front.lore: Medium transport with boosted hyperdrive. Armor and capacity diminished. Crew trained for reconnaissance and swift intergalatic transport.

combo: Luminous + Covert Landing

front.title: M-HYD 'Binary' Droid
front.gametext: Adds 2 to forfeit of each non-droid character at same and adjacent sites. At any time, any player may use 1 Force to turn M-HYD off (face down) or on again (face up).
front.lore: Pretentious hydroponics droid. Specializes in working with binary load lifters and vaporators. Proficient in a number of languages but prefers to converse only in binary.

front.title: •Mace Windu
front.gametext: Deploys +3 to any location except Jedi Council Chamber. While at Jedi Council Chamber, immune to attrition and once during your control phase, if Amidala at a battleground site and Maul not on table, opponent loses 2 Force.
front.lore: Senior Jedi Council member who maintains rigorous adherence to the Code. Sent Qui-Gon to Naboo to accompany the Queen and learn more about the mysterious 'dark warrior'.

combo: Mace Windu + Smoke Screen + Are You Brain Dead?!

front.title: •Mace Windu (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys +3 to any location except Jedi Council Chamber. While at Jedi Council Chamber, immune to attrition and once during your control phase, if Amidala at a battleground site and Maul not on table, opponent loses 2 Force.
front.lore: Senior Jedi Council member who maintains rigorous adherence to the Code. Sent Qui-Gon to Naboo to accompany the Queen and learn more about the mysterious 'dark warrior'.

front.title: •Mace Windu (V)
front.gametext: During battle, Mace may 'swing' one lightsaber twice. Fetts may not add battle destiny draws here. Immune to attrition <6 (<8 if with a Dark Jedi).
front.lore: Senior Jedi Council member who maintains rigorous adherence to the Code. Sent Qui-Gon to Naboo to accompany the Queen and learn more about the mysterious 'dark warrior'.

combo: Mace Windu (V) + Are You Brain Dead?!

front.title: •Mace Windu (V) (AI)
front.gametext: During battle, Mace may 'swing' one lightsaber twice. Fetts may not add battle destiny draws here. Immune to attrition <6 (<8 if with a Dark Jedi).
front.lore: Senior Jedi Council member who maintains rigorous adherence to the Code. Sent Qui-Gon to Naboo to accompany the Queen and learn more about the mysterious 'dark warrior'.

front.title: •Mace Windu, Jedi Master
front.gametext: Deploys -2 on Naboo. While on Naboo, once during your control phase may use 1 Force to cancel Maul's immunity to attrition for remainder of turn. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 while on Naboo).
front.lore: Jedi Council member who is known to be one of the strongest members of the Council. Has come to Naboo to investigate the death of the mysterious 'dark warrior.'

combo: Mace Windu, Jedi Master + Are You Brain Dead?!
cancels: Maul's immunity to attrition for remainder of turn while on Naboo

front.title: •Mace Windu, Jedi Master (AI)
front.gametext: Deploys -2 on Naboo. While on Naboo, once during your control phase may use 1 Force to cancel Maul's immunity to attrition for remainder of turn. Immune to attrition < 3 (< 5 while on Naboo).
front.lore: Jedi Council member who is known to be one of the strongest members of the Council. Has come to Naboo to investigate the death of the mysterious 'dark warrior.'

front.title: •Mace Windu's Lightsaber
front.gametext: Deploy on Mace. May add 1 to Force drain where present. Mace may add 1 to his duel total. May target a character or creature for free. Draw two destiny. Target hit, and its forfeit = 0, if total destiny > defense value.
front.lore: Elegant sword of pure energy. 'This is the weapon of a Jedi Knight. Not as clumsy or as random as a blaster.' A lightsaber can be dangerous to an unskilled user.

front.title: Magnetic Suction Tube
front.gametext: Deploy on your sandcrawler. Once during each of your control phases, may target one character present. Draw destiny. If destiny > character's ability, 'suck up' character (relocate to related interior Sandcrawler site or owner's Used Pile).
front.lore: Retractable tube originally designed to collect mined materials for transport to refining facilities. Jawas now use it to suck up droids (and anything else that's not nailed down).

front.title: •Major Bren Derlin
front.gametext: While on Hoth, opponent may not 'react' to any Echo site, and Derlin may use 1 Force to cancel Breached Defenses. While at Cantina, power +1 and may use 1 Force to cancel Local Trouble.
front.lore: Hero of Nentan. Supervised construction of Echo Base on Hoth. Head of base security. At the Mos Eisley Cantina, everyone knows his name.

cancels: 'Reacts' to any Echo site while on Hoth

front.title: •Major Bren Derlin (V)
front.gametext: Scout. Deploys free to (and power +2 at) Cantina, Endor, or Hoth. Opponent may not 'react' to or from here. Once per game, may retrieve an Explosive Charge into hand.
front.lore: Hero of Nentan. Supervised construction of Echo Base on Hoth. Head of base security. At the Mos Eisley Cantina, everyone knows his name.

front.title: •Major Caluan Ematt
front.gametext: May deploy -2 as a react to an [Episode VII] site. At the end of each turn, you must use 2 Force, lose 2 Force, or return Ematt to your hand.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Major Haash'n
front.gametext: Deploys -2 to any Star Cruiser. Adds 2 to the power of any capital starship he pilots. When piloting a Star Cruiser, adds 1 to hyperspeed and armor and cancels Lateral Damage targeting a starship at same system.
front.lore: Mon Calamari master engineer. Joined the Alliance to fulfill his personal goal of piloting star cruisers.

cancels: Lateral Damage when piloting a Star Cruiser

front.title: •Major Harter Kalonia
front.gametext: Resistance characters here may not have their forfeit reduced. If you just forfeited a 'hit' non-droid character from same or related site, may lose 1 Force to place that character in Used Pile.
front.lore: Female.

front.title: •Major Olander Brit
front.gametext: Power and forfeit +1 while present with Major Panno. When with Major Panno at a site, adds one battle destiny. When present with a Scomplink, cancels Counter Assault at a related site where you have a spy or scout.
front.lore: Communications expert. Staff monitors entire spectrum of electromagnetic signals. Politically minded. Followed Panno to the Alliance.

cancels: Counter Assault at a related site where you have a spy or scout

front.title: •Major Palo Torshan
front.gametext: Deploys -2 on a Rebel Base. While at your war room, adds 1 to your Attack Run total. Once during each of your control phases, may use 1 Force to take one Double Agent or Sabotage into hand from Reserve Deck; reshuffle.
front.lore: Coordinator of Rebel base security. Served under General Dodonna at Yavin 4. Sat in on conferences planning the Battle of Yavin. Developed counterintelligence techniques.

front.title: •Major Panno
front.gametext: While at a system or an exterior battleground site, allows you to activate up to 2 additional Force for each related exterior battleground site you occupy with a scout (limit 4 additional Force).
front.lore: Male Dresselian scout. Former commando. Tactician. Works with General Madine to plan logistics of strike operations.

combo: Major Panno + Major Olander Brit

front.title: •Major Taslin Brance
front.gametext: If opponent just looked at cards in their deck or pile, after replacing, you may peek at the top card of that deck or pile. At the start of your control phase, if the top card of your lost pile is a Resistance character or [Restistance] starship, opponent loses 1 Force.
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Make Ten Men Feel Like A Hundred
front.gametext: If Stardust on table, deploy on table. Nightfall is canceled. Saw is a spy. Rebel spies deploy -1 to Scarif. Once per battle, if you just drew a Rebel spy for destiny, may retrieve 1 Force. (Immune to Alter.)
front.lore: Blank.

front.title: •Malastare
